loans.name: La Ponderosa (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Ponderosa esta conformado por 8 mujeres y 2 hombres quienes son muy alegres y trabajadoras, luchan día a día en sus trabajos y negocios para mejorar la economía de sus hogares. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por su belleza natural, su gente se dedica al comercio y también a la agricultura y cría de animales.

La Señora. Lía Z. es socia del banco comunal La Ponderosa, vive en la comunidad de Castilla Cruz Alta, este es su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación. Tienen 41 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 20, 18, 13, 12 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos  trabajan y le ayudan en la economía de su hogar, también estudian por la noche, su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita del sector, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de familiares. 
Doña Lía trabaja como empleada domestica, actividad que la desempeña hace 5 años, labora de lunes a viernes de 8 de la mañana hasta las 12 del medio día, en su casa se dedica a la agricultura sembrando hortalizas las que son para su consumo y también las vende en su comunidad.  El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para iniciar con esta actividad. Su meta es  comprarse un terreno para construir su casa.

La Señora María J. vive por la parroquia del Valle, tiene 41 años, es  viuda y tiene  2 hijos de 20 y 17 años de edad, sus hijos son casados y viven independientes. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en una casa que cuida. 
Doña María se dedica a la agricultura, que es mas para su consumo, también  cría  animales como: cuyes, pollos y ganado, las ganancias que obtiene es compartido a medias con la dueña de la casa. 
Es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado. Su meta es  comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Ponderosa is made up of 10 very hard-working and cheerful members,  8 women and 2 men.  They strive daily in work and business to improve their household economic situations.  They live in the area surrounding the Valle parish, a parish characterized by its natural beauty.  The people here work in commerce, agriculture and animal husbandry.  

Señora Lía Z. is a member of the communal bank La Ponderosa and lives in the Castilla Cruz Alta community.  This is her first loan with the foundation.  She is 41 years old and is a single mother to 4 children ages 20, 18, 13 and 12.  Her oldest three children work and help her with the household expenses and also, study at night.  Her youngest attends the neighborhood school.  She doesn't own her own home but lives in a house that belongs to a family member.  Doña Lía has worked as a domestic employee for 5 years.  She works Monday through Friday from 8:00 am until noon.  At home she grows vegetables for her family's consumption and also to sell in her community.  With the money from the loan, she plans to start a new business and invest in guinea pigs.  Her goal is to buy a piece of land to build her own house.  

Señora María J. lives by the Valle parish.  She is 41 years old, a widow and has two children ages 20 and 17.  Her children are married and live independently.  She doesn't own her own house, but is the caretaker for the house that she lives in.  Doña María also works in agriculture and grows mostly for her own consumption, but also raises animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and cattle.  She shares what she earns with the woman who owns the house she lives in.  This is her first loan with the communal bank which she plans to use to purchase cattle.  Her goal is to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase guinea pigs and cattle

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es:
La Señora. María F. es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive en la comunidad de Llariviña que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, en esta parroquia se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, cuenta con una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes cargos.
 
Doña María tiene 75 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. Su esposo pasa en casa ya que es jubilado, con el trabajo conyugal ha construido su casa propia.
 
La Señora. María labora en una tienda que es de su propiedad hace 40 años, atiende su negocio de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 10 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para su tienda. Su meta es mejorar su tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. María F. is a member of the Unión Progresista (Progressive Union) communal bank.  She lives in the community of Llariviña which belongs to Santa Ana parish.  In this parish one can admire a large part of the city of Cuenca.  It has a beautiful view of nature.  Its residents are farmers and raise animals; many work at different jobs in the city.

María is 75 years old, married and has three adult, married, independently-living children.  Her husband is retired and stays home.  Through their labor as a couple they have built their own house.

María works in a store she’s owned for 40 years.  She is open from Sunday to Sunday from 6am until 8pm.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for 10 years and will use the money from her loan to buy stock items for her store; her goal is to improve her store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and other basic need items.

loans.name: Gloria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria Bustamente es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive en la comunidad de Llariviña que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, en esta parroquia se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, cuenta con una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes cargos.
 
La Señora. Gloria tiene 26 años, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad y ahora está embarazada de 7 meses y esta muy contenta por ello. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil y también es agricultor, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en una casa de un familiar.
 
Doña Gloria debido a su estado de gestación se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, también cría ganado y  aves de corral.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito y fue invitada por la señora presidenta del banco comunal quien es su amiga, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y ganado. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria B. is a member of the Unión Progresista (Progressive Union) communal bank.  She lives in the community of Llariviña which belongs to Santa Ana parish.  In this parish one can view a large part of the city of Cuenca.  It has beautiful views of nature.  Its residents are farmers and raise animals; many work at various jobs in the city.

Gloria is 26 years old, lives in a common law relationship and has a 3 year old son.  She is now seven months pregnant and is very happy because of this.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer and is also a farmer.  She does not have a house of her own and lives in a relative’s house.

Because of her current pregnancy, Gloria does household chores and raises cattle and barnyard fowl.

This is her second loan.  She was invited by the bank’s Madam President, who is her friend.  The money from the loan will be used to buy cattle and chickens.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy cattle and chickens.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María L. es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive en la comunidad de Pichacay que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, en esta parroquia se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, cuenta con una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes cargos.
 
Doña María tiene 53 años, es madre soltera y tiene 8 hijos, tres son casados y viven  independientes, sus tres hijos siguientes trabajan para sus gastos, una de sus hijas pasa en casa y le ayudan en los quehaceres del hogar y su ultimo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. María se dedica a la agricultura y lo que produce es solo para su consumo, cría ganado y la leche que obtiene realiza quesillos que vende en la ciudad, también cría cerdos, gallinas y borregos los que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas y de animales. Su meta es  tener más ganado.
texts.en:
Maria es a member of the Union Progresista (Progressive Union) Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Pichacay in Santa Ana parish. From this parish you can admire a grand part of the city of Cuenca. It also has a beautiful view of nature.  The people are dedicated to raising livestock and to agriculture. Many work in the city in different jobs.

Maria is 53 years old and a single mother with 8 children. Three are married and live independently. Her next 3 children work to pay their own way. One of her daughters still lives at home and helps Maria with household chores. Her last child studies in a city school. From her own work she has been able to construct her own house.

Maria works in agriculture and what she produces is only for their consumption. She raises cattle and with the milk she makes cheeses to sell in the city. Also, she raises pigs, chickens, and sheep, which she sells when there is the necessity.

Maria has been a member of her communal bank for some 2 years. The loan will be invested in buying seeds and livestock. Her goal is to have more cattle.

loans.use: TO BUY FARM ANIMALS AND SEEDS

loans.name: Rolando Eduardo

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene dos hijos. Vive junto a su familia en uno de los distritos de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino. Él cría ovejas en su domicilio, las alimenta en base a pastos naturales y cuando estas han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, y le permite solventar sus gastos personales, así como ayudar a su familia. Por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.

Actualmente desea adquirir alimento balanceado para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de un mejor modo y así poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rolando is 45 years old, has a live-in spouse and two children.  He lives with his family in one of Tambogrande’s districts, a district of Piura province, Piura region, which is notable because most of its residents are fruit growers.

He raises sheep.  He raises sheep at home feeding them natural grasses.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants that tend to visit the area where he lives.  This activity is his main source of support that permits him to meet his personal expenses as well as help his family.  Because of this he always strives to maintain it in the best possible way.

He currently wants to acquire nutritionally balanced feed so that his animals will develop better thus increasing sales and profits.  To reach this objective he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed to feed his animals.

loans.name: Santos Candido

texts.es:
Santos tiene 61 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su familia en uno de los distritos de Tambogrande, un distrito de L. provincia de Piura, en L. región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Se dedica a L. crianza y venta de ganado porcino y caprino. Él cría ovejas en su domicilio, las alimenta en base a pastos naturales y cuando estas han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar L. zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, y le permite solventar sus gastos personales, así como ayudar a su familia. Por ello siempre trata de mantenerL. del mejor modo posible.

Adicionalmente se dedica a L. agricultura.  Cuenta con un terreno donde cultiva mango y limón.  Estos frutos los comercializa a buen precio a sus vecinos, quienes acuden a comprarle por el trato amable que reciben.

Actualmente desea adquirir alimento balanceado para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de un mejor modo y así poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Santos, 61, has a live-in spouse and a son.  He lives with his family in one of Tambogrande’s districts, a district in Piura province, Piura region, and notable because its residents are mostly fruit growers.

He raises pigs and goats.  He raises goats at home feeding them natural grasses.  When they have reached a good level of development he sells them to merchants that frequent his neighborhood.  This activity is his main source of income that allows him to meet personal expenses and help his family.  Because of this he always strives to maintain it in the best possible way.

In addition he is a farmer.  He has a piece of land where he grows mangoes and lemons.  He sells these products at good prices to his neighbors who come to buy from him because of the kind treatment they receive from him.

He currently would like to acquire nutritionally balanced feed so that his animals will grow better thus increasing sales and profits.  To reach this goal he has requested a 500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed for his animals.

loans.name: Lizandro Eudoro

texts.es:
Lizandro tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su familia en uno de los distritos de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Se dedica al transporte en mototaxi (un vehículo de transporte muy común en la zona que está compuesta por una moto y una cabina para transportar pasajeros en distancias cortas).  Lizandro es muy conocido en su zona, por lo que tiene una clientela fidelizada.  Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, y le permite solventar sus gastos personales, así como ayudar a su familia. Por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.

Actualmente Lizandro desea reparar su mototaxi que por el uso se ha desgastado. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lizandro, 43, has a live-in spouse and a son.  He lives with his family in one of Tambogrande’s districts, a district in Piura region, Piura province and notable because most of its residents are fruit growers.

He provides mototaxi (a transportation vehicle very commonplace in the area composed of a motorcycle with an attached cabin to transport passengers over short distances) transportation services.  Lizandro is very well known in the area so he has a regular customer base.  This activity is his main source of support allowing him to meet personal expenses as well as help his family.  Because of this he always strives to maintain it in the best possible condition.

Lizandro currently needs to repair his mototaxi because it has become run down due to use.  To reach his objective he has requested a 500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: For mototaxi repair.

loans.name: Mary Jane's Group

texts.en:
Mary Jane F. is from the village of Barangay Palabotan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 32 years old. Mary Jane is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mary Jane is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns & operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the product offering. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Mary Jane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

location.town: Brgy. Palabotan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

In 2011, Leonila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DEGGO est créé depuis environs 09 ans. Il est composé de 04 femmes qui sont du même quartier. Elles se sont constituées par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois des ressortissantes de Kaguitt.

Madame BINTOU D. tout à fait à droite de la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 65 ans et mère de 10 enfants.

Elle fait du petit commerce. Elle vend des tissus thioup et des fruits de saisons. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux développer son activité en renforçant son niveau d'approvisionnement.

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins familiaux et d'augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The Deggo solidarity group was created around 9 years ago. It is composed of four women, all from the same neighborhood. They know each other through ties of affinity and neighborhood. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of the residents of Kaguitt.

Mrs Bintou D., standing far right in the picture and raising her hand, chairs the group. She is 65 years old and the mother of ten children. She runs a small store. She sells thioup (hand-dyed) fabrics and seasonal fruits. She has been in this activity for over 10 years.

Her new loan will enable her to improve her business by expanding its inventory. Her goal is to provide for her family and save more money.

loans.use: To buy thioup fabrics and fruits

loans.name: Temaxcal Group

texts.es:
Esta Unidad de Desarrollo UDE se llama Temaxcal porque es el nombre de la comunidad donde viven los integrantes, este grupo esta ubicado en la comunidad de San M. Soyaltepec(temaxcal) en el estado de Oaxaca. El grupo esta integrado por 
siete integrantes.

La representante del grupo se llama Maria Trinidad E. R. que tiene 51 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer grado de secundaria, es casada y es madre de dos hijos de los cuales uno es hombre y la otra es mujer ellos ya estan casados. Doña mary como la conocen sus vecinos desde hace mas de 25 años decidio iniciar su propio negocio de venta de tacos, pasteles y tamales,  tambien tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su hogar, ya que deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y queria derles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de arina, colorante, maiz, variedad de chiles, frijol, arroz, aceite, manteca, desechable, refrescos y dulces. doña mary nos dijo que espera que esta inversion le deje buenas ganancias ya que desea en un futuro comprar nuevos instrumentos para realizar sus pasteles.

La señora Maricela E. R. tambien es miembro del grupo Temaxcal, ella tiene 35 años, solo termino de estudiar la secundaria, es casada y es madre de dos hijos de los cuales uno es una niña de 17 años que estudia la preparatoria y un niño de diez años que asiste a la primaria de la comunidad. Doña maricela desde hace 2 años inicio con su propio negocio de venta de sabanas y colchas, ella vende casa por casa y algunas veces hace tandas de sus colchas con sus vecinas y amigas, tambien nos platica que ella decidio iniciar su propio negocio ya que deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los estudios de sus hijos y los gastos del hogar. ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de sabanas y colchas para posteriormente venderlas, doña maricela espera que sus ganancias sean buenas ya que desea que su negocio continue prosperando ya que quiere que sus hijos tengan una profesion.

los otros 5 integrantes son: 
Diego C.  S. - venta de tortillas en su motocicleta
Valentina CL. A. - venta de zapatos por catalogo
Juana CL. C. - venta de sabanas 
Ambrocia M. A. - venta de ropa 
Suhail L. H. - venta de zapatos
texts.en:
This Development Cooperative is named Temaxcal after the community where the members live.  This group is located in the community of San M. Soyaltepec (Temaxcal) in the state of Oaxaca and is comprised of seven members.

The group’s representative is Maria Trinidad E. R..  She is 51 years old, and completed three years of secondary school. She is married and the mother of a son and a daughter who are also married.  Mary, as she has been known by her neighbors for more than 25 years, decided to start her own business selling tacos, cakes, and tamales.  She also runs a grocery store from her home since she wants to help her husband with the household expenses and wants to give her children a better quality of life.  She needs this loan to buy flour, coloring, corn, a variety of chili peppers, beans, rice, oil, butter, disposable goods, soft drinks, and candy.  Mary tells us that she hopes that this investment provides her with good income because in the future, she wants to buy utensils for making her cakes.

Maricela E. R. is also a member of the Temaxcal Group.  She is 35 years old and only completed secondary school.  She is married and mother of a 17 year old daughter who studies at preparatory school and a ten year old son who attends the community’s primary school.  Two years ago, Maricela started her own business selling sheets and bedspreads.  She sells door to door and sometimes makes batches of her bedspreads with her neighbors and friends.  She also tells us that she decided to start her own business because she wants to help her husband pay for the education of her children and the household expenses.  She needs this loan to buy sheets and bedspreads to sell later.  Maricela hopes that her income is good and her business continues prospering as she wants her children to become professionals.

The other five members are:
Diego C. S. who sells tortillas and delivers them by motorcycle
Valentina CL. A. who sells shoes by catalog
Juana CL. C. who sells sheets
Ambrocia M. A. who sells clothing
Suhail L. H. who sells shoes

loans.use: Sale of clothing, shoes, bedspreads, cakes, tamales, and groceries

loans.name: Leo Group

texts.es:
Esta unidad de desarollo (UDE) se llama Leo porque son fuertes y 
luchadores como un leon. Las UDEs son grupos de mas de 10 personas que tienen
una cuenta de banco y tienen que reunirse semanalmente o quincenalmente para
realizar sus pagos. Tiene un representante y un comite que lo gobierna. Este grupo 
esta ubicado en la comunidad de Tezonapa en el estado de VeraC.. Este grupo esta conformado
por diez integrantes.

El representante del grupo se llama Eloisa C. S. que tiene la edad de 45 años,
 estudio solo la primaria, es viuda y tiene una pequeña hija de nombre Lesli Alexandra de 10 años de edad 
que esta cursando el quinto grado de primaria. Doña Elo como la conocen en su comunidad desde hace 
mas de 31 años se dedica a la costura, ella confecciona ropa para dama y caballero, nos dice que en septiembre y 
noviembre es cuando mas trabajo tiene ya que sus clienta mandan a hacer con ella los uniformes escolares de sus hijos
tambien nos  dice que cuando es la fiesta del pueblo cose los trajes para los bailarines de las comparsas, tambien
nos platica que ella con los años aprendio a reparar y darle mantenimiento a sus maquinas de coser y ahora sus 
amigas y conocidas la buscan para que les repare sus maquinas y se gana un dinerito extra. Ella necesita este credito 
para invertirlo en la compra de una nueva maquina, agujas, hilos, cintametrica, ganchos, reglas, telas, encajes, listones,botones
 y cierrres. Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea darle a Lesli una mejor calidad
de vida y espera que en un futuro su hija pueda tener una profesion.

Fabiola Elvira R. O. es parte del comite de este grupo. Ella tiene treinta años de edad, estudio hasta
la preparatoria y es Tecnico en alimentos, es madre soltera de un pequeño niño de 9 años de nombre Julio Fernando
Fabi como la llaman sus amigos nos platica que hace mas de 5 años vende junto a su mama cominida corrida en su casa,
algunas veces hace tamales o chiles rellenos los cuales vende casa por casa, fabi nos dice que algunas veces levanta pedidos
pero otras las personas van a buscar su comida ya que ya saben que vende todos los dias, ella tambien pone lonche a algunos trabajadores o 
les da de almorsar, sus vecinos nos comentan que ellas cocinan muy sabroso. Fabi necesita este prestamo para invertirlo en la compra 
de insumos (arroz, frijol, aceite, tomates, sal, azucar, cebolla, cafe, chiles, especies, maiz, huevos,carne, gas y desechables).
ella espera que este credito le de la oportunidad de creser y le deje buenas ganancias ya que en un futuro espera tener un 
pequeño local en el poner una pequeña fondita, tabien desea darle una mejor calidad a su hijo.

los otros 8 integrantes se llaman:

Irma L. G. - venta de ropa
Demian A. T. - transporte (taxi)
Marlen C. S. - pollos azados
Magdalena R. M.- abarrotes
Martina O. V.- deposito de refrescos
Elia O. V. . cosina economica
Vianey Natalia R. V.- venta de zapatos
Diodora B. G. - cosina economica
texts.en:
This development unit (UDE) is called Leo because they are strong and fighters like lions.  UDEs are groups of 10 or more people who have a bank account and have to meet weekly or bi-weekly to make their payments.  They have a representative and a governing committee.  This group is located in the community of Tezonapa in the state of VeraC..  It has 10 members. 

The group's representative is Eloisa C. S..  She is 45 years old and only attended elementary school.  She is widowed and has a small daughter named Lesli Alexandra who is 10 years old and in the 5th grade.  Doña Elo, as she is called in her community, has worked as a seamstress for more than 31 years.  She makes clothing for men and women. She tells us that she has the most work in September and November when her customers order school uniforms for their children.  She also tells us that for her town's festival, she sews costumes for the dancers in the "comparsa" (parade). Over the years she has also learned to repair and perform maintenance on her sewing machines and now her friends and acquaintances seek her out to repair their machines, so she earns a little extra money.  She needs this loan to invest in a new sewing machine, needles, thread, measuring tape, hooks, rulers, fabrics, lace, ribbons, buttons, and fasteners. She hopes that with this investment her business will prosper so she can give Lesli a better quality of life, and she hopes that in the future her daughter will have a profession.

Fabiola Elvira R. O. is part of the governing committee of this group.  She is 30 years old and completed her education through high school. She has a technical degree in nutrition.  She is a single mother of a 9 year old son named Julio Fernando.  Fabi, as she is called by her friends, tells us that for the past 5 years she and her mother have sold quick meals out of their home.  Sometimes they also make tamales or chiles rellenos (stuffed peppers) to sell door to door.  Fabi tells us that sometimes they take orders but other times people just show up for food since they know Fabi and her mother sell it every day. They also prepare lunches for workers.  Their neighbors comment that their food is very tasty.    

Fabi needs this loan to purchase ingredients (rice, beans, oil, tomatoes, salt, sugar, onion, coffee, peppers, spices, corn, eggs, meat, cooking gas, and disposable tableware. She hopes that this loan gives her the opportunity to grow and provides good income, as she would like to have a place to open a small restaurant in the future.  She also wants to provide her son with a better quality of life.

The other 8 members of the group are:

Irma L. G. - clothing sales
Demian A. T. - transportation (taxi)
Marlen C. S. - roasted chicken
Magdalena R. M.- groceries
Martina O. V.- drink stand
Elia O. V. - low cost meals
Vianey Natalia R. V.- shoe sales
Diodora B. G. - low cost meals

loans.use: chicken sales, prepared meals, dressmaking, taxi

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily L. is very happy and feels so excited about the support that she received from Kiva lenders for her previous loan. Emily prays they all be blessed. She has a good relationship with her group mates, center and institution as well.

Now, Emily is proposing another Kiva loan to continue her business of buying & selling Anion products (Sanitary napkin) and to continue supporting the maintenance of her sewing business. She has been able to improve her businesses due to her access to bigger loans from Kiva supporters.

Emily discovered the huge impact the loan has made on her family as, with the additional income, she was able to afford to buy desired needs and ensure prompt weekly payment of her obligation to ASHI. She is also happy because she is able to feed well and support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. 

Emily hopes right now is that their businesses will continue to succeed because this has been their life, providing for their family for more than 12 years now. They love what they do in making their business achievement.

Emily’s business has been very supportive in achieving her dreams for her children. For her, it is a joy to see fulfillment in her businesses and family and, with her 3 children growing up, she will want to see them having the best in life someday.

Now she still prays that her businesses will bring continued success for her to be able to send all of her children until complete college. And she promises ASHI that she will work hard so that the chances that they give her will never be wasted.

loans.use: To buy more Anion products (sanitary napkins) and to continue supporting the maintenance of her sewing business.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Her husband’s support of her farming business is Candida’s inspiration to continue through the challenges of poverty but growing her business despite that. The farming business has brought pleasure to Candida’s family. Because of its profits, she has been able to support the family’s need. 

Being a good mother and grandmother, Candida always wanted to support her children in whatever career they would be taking to better their own personal life and support grandchildren to complete college. Aside from Candida’s farming business financed by the loan she received from ASHI, she also has a retailing business which is her way of saving her profits to support the needs of her family, especially for her grandchildren’s education until college. With that, Candida is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds “palay”, and support the maintenance of her retail business. This would provide for her and make their business grow, and make more profit, which will enable her to support her ambition in life.

Candida has been an ASHI member since 2002. Her family is very glad that she has an opportunity to improve their quality of living through the income of the farming business she has established with the support of the loans she has requested.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, rice seeds "palay", and support the maintenance of her retail business.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: Mrs. Khom K. buys silk products from weavers in her village and then transports and sells them in other villages and districts. Her husband has full-time employment, working far away from home. The couple has two children, one son and one daughter, who both attend school. Khom has asked for a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more silk and cotton fabrics for resale.

loans.use: to purchase silk and cotton products for resale

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en: Voeun P., 38, is single. She lives with her parents and two brothers on an island in the Mekong River, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Voeun has been a weaver since she was fifteen years old. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then sells them in a Phnom Penh market. Voeun is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase weaving materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Kantutitas De San Simon Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Kantutitas de San Simón” iniciará su  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana,  se han reunido para solicitar crédito y recibir servicios en salud y capacitación.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados:  Venta de Tejas,  taller para elaborar mochilas, taller de carpintería, artículos varios, venta de productos de limpieza, taller de tejidos, tejidos y taller de bordado.
La B.C. “Kantutitas de San Simón” está dirigida por una mesa directiva: la señora Flora es la presidenta, la señora Yolanda es la tesorera y la señora Celia es la secretaria de actas. 
La señora Flora, presidenta de la banca comunal, indica que  esta es su primera experiencia como socia de Pro Mujer.   Su negocio es la venta de “cachivaches”(nombre que le da a los productos pequeños que se utilizan en el hogar, como por ejemplo: pasta dental, ganchos de ropa, agujetas, cepillos de dientes y otros).  Lleva adelante este negocio desde hace dos años, las ventas son realizadas en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto los días martes y domingo. El crédito solicitado le dará la oportunidad a la señora Flora de aumentar su mercadería y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The “Kantutitas de San Simón” communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer. As part of the Panamericana Regional Hub, the group has met to apply for a loan and to receive training and health services. The group has nine members. They work in a variety of businesses: tile sales, a workshop for making backpacks, carpentry shop, various items, sales of cleaning products, knitting shop, knitted items and embroidery shop.

The “Kantutitas de San Simón” communal bank has a board of directors: Flora is the president, Yolanda is the treasurer and Celia is the recording secretary.

Flora, the communal bank's president, says this is her first experience as a Pro Mujer member. Her business is selling “cachivaches” (a name for the small items that are used around the home, such as toothpaste, clothes hangers, shoelaces, toothbrushes, etc.). She has had this business for two years, making her sales at the markets in El Alto on Tuesdays and Sundays. This loan will give Flora the chance to add to her merchandise and have better earnings.

loans.use: Purchase toothpaste, creams, clothes hangers, batteries

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en:
Mr. Sokny C., 32 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Kemsreang Yang, 31 years old, live along National Road 5, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2001 and have two children, a son and a daughter. One child attends school and the other is still young. 

Sokny is a rice farmer and a fisherman. His wife sells slush, or shaved ice dessert, in her village. Sokny is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm. He will also use the loan to connect his house to a private electricity utility service.

loans.use: for farming supplies and for connecting his house to electricity

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a busy entrepreneur managing a fishing business. Her previous loan from ASHI has provided working capital to expand her business and purchase additional fishing materials. With this loan, Rosemarie has noticed that her monthly income has almost doubled, since she has attracted new customers with additional inventory of fish.

Rosemarie joined Kiva's partner, ASHI, in 2001, attracted by ASHI's lower interest rates and range of loans for business, education and home repair. Prior to ASHI, Rosemarie had no access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Positive growth from her business has helped Rosemarie fund the education of her children. Since joining ASHI, Rosemarie has experienced positive changes in her life. She hopes her fishing business will continue to flourish so she can provide long-term financial stability for her family.

Her fishing business also contributes income for them and that’s why, even if sometimes selling fish is hard to do, she never gets tired of doing it. Therefore, she is now requesting another loan for the much larger amount of 45,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase an additional fishnet and support the maintenance of their pump boat. This will allow her to grow their business further so that their children can fulfill their dreams of experiencing a life that’s full of happiness. She is continuing to pray and wishes lenders all the best and good luck. She hopes they will continue to support poor families like them, who want to improve their standard of living. Her long-term goals are to help support her children's education, invest and build a better house for the family, and to have a full-fledged fishing business.

loans.use: To buy a fishnet and support the maintenance of their pump boat to catch more fish to sell

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en: Eugene S. is from the village of Turod. He is 21 years old, married and has one small child. To make a living, Eugene provides tricycle transport services to local community members. Eugene has been in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Eugene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Eugene is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use additional income to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle for better service

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma P. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Emma owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily goats, for sale. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. Emma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the third loan taken out by Emma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith R. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Judith is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Judith operates a fish business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fish in the market. Judith has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2011, Judith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Judith from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan L.'s main source of income comes from making and selling banana cue and other snacks. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Naggasican, Santiago. Susan has been in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Susan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Susan is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es: Judith Damián  tiene 37 años, es conviviente  y tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar, la Sra.  Vende comida, dulces, bocaditos en el colegio de sus hijos,  desde ya hace 3 años que trabaja con Edaprospo y gracias a ello ha podido mejorar su casa y sus condición de vida piensa invertir el ultimo préstamo en mas mercadería para su negocio y a futuro le gustaria poner su restaurante en su propia casa, Gotitas de amor lo conforman 10 amigas con ganas de prosperar y gracias a su esfuerzo y Edaprospo lo conseguirán.
texts.en:
Judith Damián is 37 years old, lives in a common-law partnership and has three school-aged children.  She sells food, sweets and snacks at her children's school.

She has been working with Edaprospo for three years and through the entity has been able to improve her home and living conditions.  She plans to use the latest loan to buy more goods for her business.  Some time in the future she would like to set up her own restaurant out of her home.

The "Gotitas de Amor" group is made up of ten friends who want to get ahead.  Thanks to Edaprospo and their own efforts they will be able to reach their goals.

loans.use: To buy products for retail sale

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en: Dionicio C.'s main source of income comes from operating a tricycle transport service. He is 41 years old, married and has five school-aged children. They are from the village of Turod. Dionicio has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Dionicio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Dionicio is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle for better service

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda P. owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 46 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Nagassican, Santiago. Imelda has been in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chamreun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamreun H. is a widowed mother with two daughters. Both have full-time employment. The family lives in a village along national road number two about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chamreun is a cleaner for a garment factory. She traveled to work by her bicycle very often. She already asked for a Kiva loan to purchase a motorbike. Unluckily, the motorbike was stolen; she is again commuting to work by bicycle.

Hence, she has applied for another loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to get to work

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is 50 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Gata, a part of Jimenez municipality in Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Jocelyn operates a fish business that involves buying and selling fish in the market. Jocelyn has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. Jocelyn successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC that was used for capital to start her business. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan, her third from GDMPC, of 7,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena T. is from the village of Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Elena owns and operates a business planting and harvesting flowers for sale. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Elena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Joysie

texts.en:
At her age, 43 years old, Joysie never feels tired of doing things to make money for their everyday living. Her husband, Roberto, sometimes gives her some money from his salary as an OFW (Overseas Contract Worker). However, Joysie does not stop there because she knows her children need her support to achieve their own dreams in life. That’s why she decided to join and borrow from Kiva's field partner, Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), for the secured capital that she needs for her rice sales. 

Her business is operating but Joysie needs additional funds to expand her business. She wants to increase the stock of rice that she sells in her house. This will make her business grow. Joysie has a simple dream:  ensuring her family does not experience hardship will make her happy. That’s why she will never get tired of helping them, even in little ways. If her dreams come true, Joysie also hopes to extend her helping hand to others – most especially her relatives who also need support. Joysie is very glad for the inspiration and encouragement, which give her the strength to continue dreaming for the best in life.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice that she sells in her home

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma P. is from the village of Poblacion, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Gemma  works in someone else's store, selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Gemma  has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gemma  is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Gemma  from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothy L. and her husband, Mr. Him Horn, both 41 years old, have been married for almost 10 years and have three children, one son and two daughters. One of their children is a cobbler in a shoe factory, one attends school and one is still young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sothy is a weaver. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then sells them in a Phnom Penh market. Sothy is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase weaving materials.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita P. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Florita owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Florita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Florita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. Florita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Florita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely A. is from the village of Dapacan Alto, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Ely owns and operates a business making and selling food such as breads, cakes and cookies, to the local community. Ely is just starting this business.

In 2009, Ely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used for additional inventory and working capital. Ely is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the third loan taken out by Ely from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 18 and 20, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger [traditional nomadic tent], in the outer ger districts of the city. Her husband works as a guard at Narlag shop, while both sons attend college. Therefore, her sons’ education cost is high. She worked as a book shop’s saleswoman from 1999 to 2005. Narantsetseg supports her family by operating a book and magazine retail stall at Narlag shop. When she first began her business in 2005, her working capital was 2,000,000 tugriks (MNT). Now she has 5,000,000 MNT in working capital and she sells books, magazines, newspapers and all kinds of pre-paid phone units. She bought her family's land with 4,500,000 MNT from her business earnings in 2010. Narantsetseg is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to buy more phone unit gift cards and New Year's astrology calendars to support her in this very busy shopping season of the year. Her 2011 year’s goal is to improve her business by expanding her current stall and increasing her working capital. She also wants to attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase more New Year's astrology calendars and phone unit gift cards for Mongolian Lunar New Year

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila B. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 33 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Turod, Quezon, Isabela. Mila has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Mila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mila is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina B. is from the village of Deboloc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Regina is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Regina operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other products needed in the local community. In 2010, Regina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Regina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Regina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en: Enkhbayar is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two sons, ages 2 and 12, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in a small house, in the outer ger districts of the city. His oldest son attends primary school. Enkhbayar’s profession is driver, though he proves to be a good entrepreneur. Enkhbayar supports his family by operating two kid’s clothing retail stalls in Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, with regular help from his wife. Enkhbayar began his business in 2001. During these 10 years, his business revenue supported and improved his family's living conditions. For example, his family bought their own land with 2,000,000 tugriks (MNT) in 2001 and built their small house with 8,000,000 MNT in 2004. They bought a small truck with 3,500,000 MNT in 2010. Now his working capital is about 4,000,000 MNT, with two inventory turnovers a month. He sells kids’ clothes all year around. Enkhbayar is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase upcoming spring clothes from Ereen City, China. It is best to purchase now, before the price increases and Chinese wholesalers go on vacation for their Lunar New Year for about a half a month. His family's goal is to move out of the ger district and buy their own apartment.

loans.use: To purchase spring clothes

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita, age 52, has a very supportive and responsible husband, Francisco, who is now 56 years old. Her husband is a fisherman – that’s why one source of their income is from fishing. Her husband works hard in the day catching fish in the lake, but he only brings home a small amount of money because the owner of the fishing equipment gets a larger amount – they only give him a percent.

So Isabelita decided to apply for a loan from Kiva's field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), to buy the things needed in fishing so that the revenue will be only for them. She will use the loan to buy fishing cages (fish traps), fishing nets, and other things needed in the fishing business. She will help her husband sell the fish he catches in the lake. 

Isabelita decided to put up this business in order to increase their daily income and meet their needs, like everyday expenses and the education of their two children. With more fish to catch and sell, Isabelita believes that sales will increase leading to higher revenue. As a dedicated member of ASHI, she ensures strong performance with regular attendance at group meetings and steady repayments. Isabelita is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her business will continue to flourish to improve the family’s quality of life and fund her children’s education until they finish college.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials such as fishing nets, fish traps, and other supplies

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mr. Thorn N., 55 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Kun Keo, 58 years old (pictured together), live along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple has been married since 1979 and has seven children, three sons and four daughters. Unfortunately, one of them died. Four of their children are married and live in separate homes, one is a construction worker and one is a sewing machine repairman.   

Thorn and his wife are rice farmers. Thorn is also a fisherman. He is asking for his first loan of $700 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm and to dig a well for family use.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide and to dig a well

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida B. is from the village of Deboloc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, separated from her spouse and has 2 school-aged children. Nida owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Nida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Nida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

About GDMPC:

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en:
Mr. Samorn L., 30 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Samorn Khoem, 29 years old, have been married since 2003 and have two daughters. They live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mr. Samorn L. sells firewood. He buys trees from fellow villagers and cuts them up for firewood. His wife was hired by her villagers to farm (growing mushrooms) to earn money to support her family. Samorn is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy firewood for resale and to purchase a trailer to carry the firewood.

loans.use: to buy firewood and to purchase a trailer

loans.name: Netilla

texts.en:
Netilla R. is from the village of Salvador, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Netilla owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Netilla is just starting this business.

In 2011, Netilla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
