في هذا المجال فهو يحب عمله كان للقرض السابق الاثر الجيد على عمله وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من عائلته واولاده وساهم في زيادة البضائع في المحل حيث انه هو المحل الوحيد في نطاق الضيعة لذلك يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديد للمحل 
وتوسيع العمل
texts.en: Husein is married with three children. He likes his market where he has been working for 20 years.  Husein is known for his exhaustive work experience and for being honest and thorough. His previous loan from Al Majmoua had a positive effect on his business. He used it to increase goods at his market, the only one in his neighborhood. Husein was fully supported by his family and children during his previous loan cycle. He wants to get a new loan from Al Majmoua to buy new goods and to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell and expand the business

loans.name: Terimbere Munyarwandakazi B Group

texts.fr: Patricie Murekatete est agricultrice, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle a 41 ans, elle est mariée, et née a Rwanda.  Elle a 4 enfants entre 7 ans et 18 ans, tous vont à l’école, et elle a fini 4 ans d’école secondaire.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter une pompe pour l’insecticide, 500 grammes de pépinière, 20 kgs d’oignons, 20 kgs de fertilisantes, et main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter la capacité de son affaire.  Elle voudrait devenir une grande agricultrice dans son secteur, assurer le bien-être de sa famille, et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Patricie Murekatete is a farmer and a client of ACB since 2010. She is 41 years old and married. She was born in Rwanda. She has four children ranging from 7 to 18 years of age, all of whom attend school. She has finished four grades of secondary school. She will use her loan to buy an insecticide pump, 500g of seeds, 20 kg of onions, 20 kg of fertilizers, and pay for manual labor. Her business strategy is to increase her production volume. She would like to become an important farmer in her area, provide for the well-being of her family and pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: Purchasing an insecticide pump, fertilizers, etc

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.ar:
محمد في عمر 49 سنة متزوج وله اربع اولاد يعمل في بيع الخبز متجول له في عمله 3 سنوات يحب عائلته ويريد لها العيش الكريم
السليم يريد دائما التجدد والتطور له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث ساهم القرض السابق في دعمه ماديا وكان يلقى الدعم من عائلته وخاصة اولاده حيث وجدوا ان والدهم يتطور في عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى تجديد وصيانة الفان خاصته
يتميز بالمثابرة والجدية في العمل يريد توسيع المصلحة وتقويتها حتى يتمكن من تحسين وضعه ووضع عائلته المادي والاجتماعي
texts.en:
Muhammad is 49 years old, married with four children. He has been working as a baker for three years. He loves his family very much and wants a stable and comfortable life for them. He is always looking for ways to develop his business. He has good credit history with A.-Majmoua as the previous loan supported him financially. He has support from his family, especially his children who found their father was developing his work. With the requested loan from A.-Majmoua he hopes to renew and repair his oven. He is persevering and determined in his work.
He wants to expand and strengthen his interests, thereby improving his and his family’s financiA. and sociA. situation.

loans.use: For maintenance work on bakery oven

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 56-year-old married woman living with her husband and three young children. She is from Lebanon. She sells bread from her house to customers from her community. She has been working hard to support her family in cooperation with her husband who works in the construction field. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new oven and some other needed products so that she can produce more, augment her sales and get higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven and some other needed products

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ar:
فاطمة في عمر 38 سنة متزوجة ولها 2 ولدان وعلى عاتقها زوجها ايضا حيث انه لا يعمل بل يساعدها في عملها لها في عملها في بيع 
الخبز والمناقيش حوالي 20 سنة تحب عائلتها وهي المعيل الوحيد لهم تريدهم دائما من العاملين والمنتجين في المجتمع حيث انها
استطاعت ان تؤسس عملها بنفسها تتميز بالجد والنشاط في العمل ولها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة كانت تتلقى دائما الدعم
تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى زيادة فرصة عمل جديدة لها من خلال شراء كارت تعبئة للهواتف النقالة وايضا اكسسوارات
للهواتف النقالة
texts.en: Fatima is 38 years old, married with 2 children and she also shoulders the responsibility for her husband who does not work but rather helps her in her bakery. She has 20 years experience. She loves her family very much and is the sole breadwinner. She constantly wants them to be contributors in the community, and she has established her business independently. She is determined and motivated. She has good credit history with Al-Majmoua and has their support. With this loan she wants to create new business opportunities by purchasing mobile phone top-up cards and phone accessories.

loans.use: To start a new business selling mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Terimberemunyarwandakazi A Group

texts.fr: Jacqueline N. est agricultrice de pommes de terre, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle a 33 ans, elle est mariée, et née a Rwanda.  Elle a 3 enfants entre 6 ans et 12 ans, tous vont à l’école, et elle a fini 3 ans d’école secondaire.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 250 kgs de pommes de terre, 50 kgs de fertilisantes, 1L…, 6 kgs détanes (insecticide), et payer la main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de cultiver ses cultures en grande quantité et devenir une grande agricultrice dans le district de Rubavu.  Elle voudrait devenir grande agricultrice au niveau provincial, faciliter le bien-être de sa famille, et augmenter le niveau d’études pour ses enfants.  Pour gagner plus de revenue, Jacqueline est aussi élévatrice de chèvres.
texts.en: Jacqueline N. is a farmer growing potatoes. She is a client of ACB since 2010. She is 33 years old and married. She was born in Rwanda. She has three children, between six and 12 years of age. She has finished three grades of secondary school. She is going to use her loan to purchase 350 kg of potatoes, 50 kg of fertilizers, 1 liter of […], six kg of insecticide and pay manual labor costs. Her business strategy is to grow large quantities of produce and become an important farmer in the Rubavu district. She would like to become  an important farmer in her province, provide for the well-being of her family, and increase her children’s educational level. In order to increase her income, Jacqueline also raises goats.

loans.use: Purchasing potato seeds, fertilizers and paying for manual labor

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah, 38, is married with 4 school-aged children who all attend school. She is a farmer in Kitale town, western Kenya where she has been farming for over 10 years. Her main product is eggs which she sells to the neighboring households and milk which she sells to the hotels around the area. 

She has requested for a loan of 70,000Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to improve her poultry farm and construct a dairy unit. She says that the proceeds from this loan will go a long way in educating her children and also food sustainability in the family. She says that the high cost of medication has been her greatest challenge.

loans.use: To improve her poultry farm and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four school-aged children. He started to work in the car mechanics field 27 years ago.  He is the only income source for the family. He repairs different types of cars. Due to his long experience in this field, he has been able to gain a good number of clients passing by his garage asking for his services. 

 Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase required machinery and tools so that he can complete his work competently, allowing him to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase required machinery and tools

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. She sells mahamri (dumplings) from home to her neighbors. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and establish a restaurant business in the future. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Roukan

texts.ar:
ركان في عمر 33 سنة متزوج وله اربع اولاد يحب عمله هو يعمل في بيع وصيانه الدواليب يحب عمله ويريد التوسع فيه 
لديه صدق في العمل ما يميزه هو الدقة في العمل والمثابرة على التطور والتجدد له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء دواليب جديدة للمصلحة
texts.en: Rakan is 33, married with four children and loves his job. He works in the manufacturing and selling of tires and would like to expand his shop. He is honest and pays attention to detail in his work and is determined to develop his business. He has a good credit history with Al-Majmoua and has attained thier full support in the past. With the loan requested from Al-Majmoua, he would like to purchase more tires to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his shop

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a tailoring business for the past eight years, operating from home. Her potential customers are neighbors. Saumu faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to expand in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase cloth materials for tailoring. She decided to join Yehu to access funds.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for tailoring

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent N. is from Ibanda. He is 32 years old and married with two children. 

He has a business of cattle fattening where he buys cattle and raises them for a while, then sells them at a profit. He works together with his wife and this has kept his family strong and together. 

His has no specific customers but deals with the general public. 

He also has another source of income from the sale of bananas. He has been in business for more than 15 years and he began the cattle fattening business after saving from the sale of bananas and goats. 

Vincent needs a loan to be able to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle for fattening

loans.name: Evaliste

texts.fr: Evaliste N. est maçon, technicien, et client d’ACB depuis 2011. Il est marié, né à Rwanda, et il a 4 enfants entre 6 ans et 19 ans.  Tous ses enfants vont à l’école, et il a une éducation d’école primaire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter les aliments pour sa famille, et payer les frais scolaires.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de continuer à bien exercice son travail.  Il voudrait épargner pour pouvoir résoudre ses problèmes facilement.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait éduquer ses enfants, et mettre sa famille en bon état.
texts.en: Evaliste N. is a carpenter, technician and a customer of ACB since 2011. He is married, born in Rwanda, and has four children between the ages of six and nineteen years old. All his children attend school and he, himself, has a primary school education. He is going to use his loan to buy food for his family and to pay the school fees. His strategy for expanding his business is to carry out his work well. He would like to be able to save in order to resolve his problems easily. He would like his family to have good living conditions and his children to be educated.

loans.use: Purchase of food for the family and payment of school fees

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a firewood-selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors. Fatuma faces a major challenge in the high cost of transporting firewood. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for sale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ar:
احمد في عمر 34 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في مطعم لبيع الدجاج له في عمله 10 سنوات يحب عمله عائلته كل
اهتمامه يريد لها التطور والاستمرار في ظروف الحياة الصعبة طموح متميز في عمله يتميز بالنظافة والدقة في العمل
له زبائن من محيط ضيعته وجيرانه ومحبيه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تطوير المصلحة وتحسين الوضع المادي له
texts.en: Ahmed is 34 years old and married with three children. He works in a restaurant selling chicken and has 10 years experience in this. He loves his work and is ambitious. His family is important to him and he wants to improve their situation and provide them with stability in difficult circumstances. He is strictly hygienic in his work and is precise. His customers include his neighbors and friends. With the requested loan from A.-Majmoua he wants to develop his business and improve his financiA. situation.

loans.use: To gain more capital to invest in the development of his business

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella B. N. is from Ibanda. She is 41 years old, very hard-working and married with children. 

For more than 12 years, she has had a business of selling bananas from Katunguru and she is able to make 240,000 UGX as monthly profits. 

She works closely with her spouse and casual laborers and her customers are mostly the people in her community. 

She is also involved in the sale of sugarcane that she grows with her husband. 

Her dream is to be able to increase productivity so that she can earn more. She needs a loan to be able to buy an extra piece of land and farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and land for agriculture

loans.name: Zaher

texts.ar:
زاهر في عمر 34 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية والاستهلاكية له في عمله 3 سنوات يريد دائما التطور
والتقدم في العمل يسعى ان يؤمن لعائلته الاستقرار والدعم المادي والمعنوي يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى توسيع المحل
وزيادة البضائع يسعى دائما الى زيادة مدخوله وتطوير عمله
texts.en: Zahir is 34 years old and married with three children. He  works in a grocery store and has three years experience. He continually aspires to develop and evolve his business and hopes to give his family stability and secure them financially. Through the requested loan from Al-Majmoua, he wants to expand his business by purchasing more goods to sell, thereby increasing his income.

loans.use: To attain the means of purchasing more goods to sell at his store

loans.name: Raul Alberto

texts.es: Raúl es un hombre que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. El tiene 35 años y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de suplementos alimenticios y dietéticos, el comenzó estos productos los consigue por encargo en Managua donde él los obtiene a un precio accesible para ofrecerlos a sus clientes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de estos productos, ya que se acerca la temporada de verano. El sueña con hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Raúl is a man with a lot of desire to get ahead. He is 35 years old and has 2 children under his care. His economic activity is the sale of nutritional and dietary suppliments. He gets his products on order in Managua for a reasonable price to offer them to his customers. The motivation for this financing is for the purchase of these products as the summer is approaching. He dreams of making his business grow.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a widowed woman with five children. She lives in her own house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She operates a food-selling business from home; her potential customers are her neighbors. Selina faces a major challenge in high competition from other food-stall operators. She hopes to expand her business stall in the future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of mangoes, wheat flour, beans and maize. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of mangoes, wheat flour, beans and maize

loans.name: Asel

texts.en:
Asel K. is 37 years old, married and has three children. She has been engaged in livestock breeding since she got married and moved to her husband’s house in Bokonbaevo village. 

Asel and her husband began this business with money that they earned from selling their personal minivan because that was the only way to find means of subsistence for their family. Starting with purchasing ten sheep and one cow, she managed to develop her farm successfully and now has two milk cows and sheep. 

With the revenues from this activity, Asel was able to pay for the education of her elder daughter, Aizhamal, who is a second-year student. 

Now, in order to increase the number of her cattle, Asel is requesting a loan of 100,000 KGS to broaden her business by purchasing more cattle. With the revenues from this investment, Asel dreams to buy a plot of land and plant it with apricot. 

Asel believes that a person’s life depends on his character and she does her best to bring up her children to be purposeful and persistent persons. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners use Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a retail shop for the past one year, selling to his local neighbors. Raphael faces a major challenge in high competition from other retail-shop operators. He hopes to expand and take another Kiva loan in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase two boxes of sweets, juices, and dozens of bathing soaps for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase two boxes of sweets, juices, and dozens of bathing soaps for sale

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo tiene 55 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de tapicería. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, no ha sido fácil mantener este negocio ya que con mucho esfuerzo ha brindado a su familia los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Ella es una persona muy responsable que con el paso del tiempo ha logrado obtener experiencia y así brindarles a sus clientes la mejor calidad en sus productos. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de telas, hilos, cuero, herramientas entre otros productos necesarios.
texts.en: Consuelo is 55 years old.  She has owned an upholstery business for more than 5 years.  It hasn't been easy keeping her business running but, through a lot of hard work, she has managed to provide her household with the income they need.  Consuelo is a very responsible person who, over time, has managed to gain experience and she thereby provides her customers with the best quality products possible.  Consuelo is requesting this loan to buy material, threads, leather, tools and other necessary products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en: Mlongo is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For over 10 years, she has operated a mahamri (dumplings) business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mlongo faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a restaurant business in the future. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase two bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil and sacks of sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase two bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil and sacks of sugar

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence M. is a married lady with three children between 25 and 14 years old. 

Florence owns a banana store at a busy market in Nairobi. She sells bananas wholesale to the retailers who resell to consumers. She has been in this business for seventeen years now. 

She says that this business is profitable. The only major challenges she has are hot weather destroying the bananas and, during some seasons, bananas are not easily available, reducing the profits she makes during the high seasons. 

However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of KES 80,000 to buy bananas to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. 

In the future, she hopes to improve her living standards and also to buy a vehicle to transport bananas in bulk. She describes herself as humble.

loans.use: To buy more bananas

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She operates a farming business, planting bananas and sugarcane for sale from home to her neighbors. Amina faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of bananas to plant in her farm. She decided to join Yehu to get education on other business opportunities and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of bananas to plant in her farm

loans.name: Nyadzua

texts.en:
Nyadzua is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a firewood selling business for the past one year, selling to her neighbours. In addition she also operates a food stall business which contributes to her other source of income. Nyadzua faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand and establish another business in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for sale.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie S. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. Winnie has a salon business, which she has run for three years. She also has an outdoor catering business.
To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase oil and braids for the hair. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Winnie hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to build a house.
Winnie is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase oil and braids for the hair

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Ruth has a business selling clothes, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Ruth hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a boutique.
Ruth is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her a loan to start her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda  S. is a married woman who lives in Ipilan, Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  general store and food production sales businesses. Her husband Hamirol, who is 54 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have eight children who are 15 to 36 years old.

 Merlinda  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merlinda  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,900, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 which she intends to use to buy stocks for the general store so that she could continue to save up for the future, her children's education and expansion of her business. 

Merlinda  S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell to customers

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Grace has a mobile business selling cosmetics, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cosmetics for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.
Grace is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by assisting her in improving her business by means of a loan.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Solome

texts.en:
Solome N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has one child.None of her children is currently in school. Solome has a business selling all types of food (food market), which she has had for two years. 
        
To help expand her business, Solome has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX  BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Solome hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to own another business operating a small retail shop. Solome is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her a loan to start a business.

loans.use: To purchase more food for resale

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman with one child who is still young for school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop selling business for the past year, selling to her local community. Sofia faces a major challenge of high competition from retail shop operators in the area. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Maliza

texts.en:
Maliza N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Maliza has a small cosmetics shop business, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Maliza has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cosmetics for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Maliza hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a plot of land.
Maliza is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by assisting her in improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda C. is a married woman who lives in Sandoval, Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a business venture: buying and selling rice grain.  Her husband Erico C., who is 42 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 1 to 12 years old. 

Emelda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emelda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use as additional capital for the rice field so that she could continue to save up for future improvement of her business and more savings. Emelda C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of a rice field

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Milly has an outside catering business, which she has run for nine years. She is also a professional nurse.
To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cooking oil and flour for her business. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Milly hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a clinic.
Milly is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by assisting her in improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Hajara has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for five years. She also has a second business selling fruits and vegetables.
To help expand her business, Hajara has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal, fruits and vegetables for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Hajara hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Hajara is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by enabling her to have more business capital by receiving a loan.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal, fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Octavio Antonio

texts.es: Octavio tiene 51 años ella se dedica a brindar el servicio carpintería, dio inicio a su negocio hace 29 años, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues han sido de gran provecho para él. La mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan diferentes productos, ya que el siempre esta dedicándose a su trabajo para ofrecer lo mejor de su negocio. El comenzó desde muy joven pues tenía una familia que mantener y como padre responsable inicio este negocio. Este crédito es para la compra pega, clavos, maque, herramientas entre otros.
texts.en:
Octavio is 51 years old and works as a carpenter.  He set up this business 29 years ago.  This is not the first time that he has taken a loan.  They have been very useful to him.  Octavio's customers request different products from him.  He is always working hard in order to provide the best work he can.  He started working at a very young age since he had a family to support and, as a responsible father, he set up this business.

Octavio will use this loan to buy adhesive, nails, lacquer, tools, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Cissy has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for one year. Cissy also has a second business of tailoring.
To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal and materials for making clothes. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Cissy hopes to generate greater profits, pay school fees and also buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Cissy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to dance and do tailoring.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and materials for making clothes

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with three children; two attend school while one is still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a mahamri (dumplings) selling business for the past two years, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours. Dzame faces a major challenge with seasonality. During the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate. She hopes to establish a selling stall in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more assorted items for her shop

loans.name: Epé Patience

texts.fr: Madame Patience à 56 ans, elle est veuve avec 2 enfants.  Pour  faire face  aux besoins de ses enfants, elle fait le commerce de fagots  de  bois. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2007 et s’approvisionne  à Kpalimé.  Elle revend ensuite  à côté du carrefour Limousine.  Elle demande un crédit au près de WAGES pour se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Mrs. Patience is 56 years old. She is a widow with two children. To provide for her children, she sells kindling. She started this business in 2007. She gets her stocks in Kpalimé for resale near the Limousine intersection. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to build up her stocks.

loans.use: To purchase kindling

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn G. is a married woman who lives in Pangobilian, Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: food production, buying and selling medicines, and buying and selling rice. Her husband, Orly G., who is 41 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have one child who is 11 years old. Marlyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marlyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,300 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000, which she intends to use to buy spices and ingredients for the food she makes. She would like to continue to save up for the future education of her children and family needs. Marlyn G. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Fund the operations of food production

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Eva has a small retail shop business, which she has run for four years. Eva has a second business of a restaurant.
To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 250,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for her restaurant. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Eva hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, she hopes to become a fashion designer.
Eva is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her the opportunity to learn tailoring.

loans.use: To purchase more food for her restaurant

loans.name: Topista

texts.en:
Topista N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. Topista has a small retail shop, which she has run for one year. She has a second business selling food.
To help expand her business, Topista has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and food for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Topista hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a boutique and a wholesale shop.
Topista is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to dance and use a computer.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar and food for resale

loans.name: Janilyn

texts.en:
Janilyn Q. is a 52-year old married woman who supports her family by running a general store. She lives in the barangay of Ipilan, part of Brooke's Point municipality, Palawan province. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 11,000 PHP.

Janilyn is now borrowing 22,000 PHP so that she can continue to purchase more inventory. This will be her seventeenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Janilyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Mariam has a business selling clothes, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Mariam hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to own another business selling charcoal.
Mariam is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her the opportunity to learn computer skills and tailoring.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Rose has a business selling food like matooke (bananas), which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself (as she has lost her father). In the future, she hopes to become a tailor in fashion design.
Rose is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by showing her how to use a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase more food for resale

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma M. is a 36-year old married woman who supports her family by running a general store. She lives in the barangay of Ipilan, part of Brooke's Point municipality, Palawan province. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 7,600 PHP.

Alma is now borrowing 11,000 PHP so that she can continue to purchase more inventory to sell. This will be her seventeenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 13,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Alma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure its future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys N. is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Gladys has a business selling cold drinks, which she has run for three years. Gladys also has a second business selling clothes.
To help expand her business, Gladys has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase drinks and clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Gladys hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a salon.
Gladys is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her the opportunity to learn to sing and dance.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of sugar and paraffin oil

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is not currently in school. Cathy has a salon business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Cathy has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a dryer and hair oil. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Cathy hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own more branches of her salon business.
Cathy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her the opportunity to learn how to plait hair and take computer studies.

loans.use: To purchase a dryer and hair oil

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Betty has a small retail shop, which she has run for two years. She also has a second business in tailoring.
To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and soap for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to build a house and expand her business further.
Betty is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by enabling her to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Namale

texts.en:
Namale S. is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Namale has a business selling clothes, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Namale has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Namale hopes to generate greater profits, pay school fees for herself and pay house rent. In the future, she hopes to build a house of her own.
Namale is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by showing her how to save money and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Harold

texts.en:
Harold is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a posho mill (a maize grinding machine) business for the past eight years. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Harold faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the dry summer season, the availability of maize for grinding is very low, hence low turnout of customers. He hopes to purchase another posho mill for grinding maize in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase a posho mill machine. He decided to work with Yehu to access loans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a posho mill (maize grinder) machine

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es: Rosa Isabel tiene dos hijos de 13 y 17 a su cargo, su actividad es la venta de ropa nueva yleña, la mayoría de sus productos los ofrece de manera ambulante ya que diariamente obtiene nuevos clientes. Inicio este medio de vida  trabajando en una zona franca con el paso del tiempo es que ha comprado más cosas y así empezar a formar este medio de vida que ahora es tan necesario. El motivo del financiamiento para comprar pantalones, shorts, faldas, y leña ya que se acerca la temporada de verano y además tiene ciertos encargos.
texts.en:
Rosa Isabel has two children aged 13 and 17 in her care.  Her business is selling new clothes and firewood.  She makes most of her sales as an itinerant street vendor and she attracts new customers every day.  She started out working in a free-trade zone.  Over time, she has bought more products to sell and she works in this field of business which is now so important to her.

Rosa Isabel is requesting this loan to buy pants, shorts, skirts and firewood since the summer season is approaching.  She also has some orders to fill.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kongweni Group

texts.en:
Saada A., who is in her early fifties, is married with 5 adult-aged children. She has been selling water for two years. She works from 6.00 a.m. to 11.00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair profit per month.

This will be Saada's first loan from Tujujenge Tanzania. She hopes to use the loan to buy a generator for pumping and increasing pressure for her water business. Her dream is to open another location for the business. Saada will share this loan with her loan group, Kongweni, which totals 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture, Saada is 1st on the right in the front row.

loans.use: to buy a generator

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria de 62 años, comenzó hace cuatro años a vender arroz poco a poco se fue convirtiendo en una microempresaria Por la dedicación que puso al trabajo y el dinero que le daba el seguro de vida comenzó a comprar quintales de arroz y venderlo a sus nuevos clientes. 

En la actualidad vende mensual de 40 a 50 quintales. Una de sus hijas le ayuda en el negocio ya que ella es viuda. Una de las dificultades de comprar el arroz a los revendedores es el alto precio que le ponen. Pero ella continua trabajando para seguir asegurando su vejez por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar quintales de arroz y tener mayor capital de trabajo. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y seguir con el negocio de venta de arroz para incrementar su cartera de clientes.
texts.en:
Maria, age 62, started selling rice four years ago.  Little by little she became a small businesswoman.  Because of the dedication that she put into her work and the money that gave her a stable life, she started to buy “quintales” (a quintal is equal to 100 pounds) of rice.  She then sold the rice to her new customers.

She now sells 40 to 50 quintales per month.  One of her daughters, a widow, helps her in the business.  One of the difficulties in buying rice from the retailers is the high price that they set.  However, she keeps working in order to continue to make sure that she is secure in her old age.

She wants the loan to buy quintales of rice and to have more work capital.  In the future she wants to finish building her house.  She also wants to continue with her rice selling business in order to increase her list of customers.

loans.use: Rice

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es:
El Senor Rodolfo D. E., es casado, de 38 anos de edad, tiene 3 hijos, habita en la Comarca El Espinal en Esteli, por razones financieras, nunca pudo asistir a un centro de educacion; desde muy corta edad se dedica a la agricultura.
Don Rodolfo recuerda que mas o menos desde los 13 anos de edad le ha tocado trabajar con sus padres en las actividades agricolas, sobre todo en la siembra de granos basicos.
Actualmente trabaja la tierra que le dejo de herencia su Papa y sigue cultivando granos basicos.
Realizo este credito para Capital de Trabajo, para compra de Insumos y Herramientas.
Su meta es tecnificar su herramientas de trabajo, para ser mas eficiente y productivo.
texts.en:
Rodolfo D. E., age 38, is married and has three children.  He lives in the El Espinal region of Esteli.  For financial reasons he has never been able to attend school.  He started working in agriculture at a very young age.  Rodolfo recalls that at about 13 years of age he started working with his parents in their agricultural activities.   They mostly worked at growing basic grains.

He currently works the land that his father left him, and he continues growing basic grains.

He is requesting this loan for working capital to buy supplies and tools.  His goal is to use 
modern technology as work a tool in order to be more efficient and productive.

loans.use: To grow basic grains

loans.name: Señor De Torrechayoc Ii Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Señor D. Torrechayoc II” ya tiene dos años D. funcionamiento y está conformado por mujeres y  varones, los socios son personas  trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad D. Urubamba departamento del Cusco. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la ciudad D. Urubamba y se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas.   
 
Las actividades económicas D. algunas D. los socios son por ejemplo; venta D. comestibles, venta D. golosinas y confitería, venta D. panes y pasteles, venta D. Omnilife y venta D. ropa. Otros socios son profesores.
  
Edelmira, tiene 45 años y nació en el distrito D. Urubamba provincia del Urubamba departamento del Cusco, Perú. Actualmente, Edelmira  es profesora y trabaja en el colegio “C.E. 50877” D. la ciudad D. Maras. Maras se encuentra a 15 minutos D. la ciudad D. Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica a enseñar y le va muy bien. Edelmira desea invertir dinero del préstamo para uso personal y no especifico para que exactamente.
texts.en:
The "Señor D. Torrechayoc II" communal bank is two years old and is maD. up of women and men.  The members are hard-working entrepeneurs who seek out every opportunity to get ahead and, through their efforts, proviD. a better future for their children.  The communal bank meets every month in the city of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  Most of the members live in Urubamba and work in different business activities.
 
The various activities incluD. sales of food, sweets, bread, pastry, Omnilife and clothing.  Some of the members are teachers.
  
Edelmira is 45 years old and was born in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, Perú.  She is a teacher at "C.E. 50877" school in the city of Maras.  Maras is about 15 minutes from Urubamba.  She has been teaching for a long time and enjoys it very much.  Edelmira plans to use the loan for personal use which she has not specified.

loans.use: For personal use

loans.name: Thelma Margarita

texts.es: Thelma Margarita se dedica a una pulpería hace más 18 años, por lo que se siente muy segura de este medio de vida que le ha brindado a ella y su familia lo necesario. Esta no es la primera experiencia que obtiene con financiamientos pues ha sido muy gratificante para ella, ya que le ha ayudado a ofrecer los productos que sus clientes solicitan. El crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, detergentes entre otros.  Desea seguir ampliando su negocio aun mas para poder dejarles a sus hijos un buen futuro y que ellos se hagan cargo.
texts.en: Thelma Margarita has been working in a small general store for over eighteen years. She feels very secure in her line of work, which has allowed her to fulfill her family's basic needs. This is not the first time she has received funding. The loan process has been very rewarding for her as it has helped her to offer her customers the products that they are looking for. She will use this loan to buy candy, soda, basic grains and detergent, among other things. She would like to expand her business even more so that she can provide her children with a brighter future and allow them to take charge of their lives.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for her store

loans.name: Augusto Cesar

texts.es:
EL Joven Augusto I., tiene 25 anos de edad, habita en la ciudad de Esteli, soltero, no tiene hijos, es comerciante.
A pesar de tantas dificultades, el inicio la carrera de Ingenieria Civil, pero no ha podido culminar con su carrera. Una tia de el es Odontologa, y miro en Jose I., muchas actitudes y talento para que el tambien estudiara lo mismo que ella, por lo que lo apoyo y lo motivo a incursionar en el area de la Odontologia.
Incio con un amigo de su tia, que tambien es odontologo, quien lo incursiono en la venta de materiales y equipos de Odontologia,para que el fuera aprendiendo acerda de esa area.
Lleva aproximadamente 3 anos de dedicarse a este negocio, y el cuenta que ha aprendido muchisimo, sobretodo a concoer a la clientela, y conocer sus necesidades; pues para realizar estas ventas, el viaja a diferentes departamentos y ciudades tales como Somoto, Ocotal, etc, al norte del pais; ya que segun el la demanda es mayor en esas zonas del pais.
A medida que paso el tiempo, fue viendo la necesidad tambien que tenian los Odontologos, sobre todo con el mantenimiento de los equipos, por lo que decidio estudiar una carrera tecnica para mantenimiento y reparacion de este tipo de equipos, en la ciudad de Masatepe, lo hace los fines de semana.
Realizo este credito para compra de algunos equipos usados, los va a revisar y a repararlos para venderlos a un mejor precio.
Su meta es poder tener su propia clinica y dedicarse a este negocio.
texts.en:
Augusto I. is 25 years old and lives in the city of Esteli. He is single, has no children, and works as a salesman. Despite many difficulties, he began studying to become a civil engineer, but was not able to complete his studies. 

One of his aunts is a dentist and saw a good attitude and a lot of promise in Jose I. and this is why she suggested that he take up her profession. She helped him and encouraged him to enter the field of dentistry. He began working with one of his aunt's friends who is also a dentist. This person got him started selling dental supplies and equipment, which helped him to learn about this field.

He has been working in this business for roughly three years now. He feels that he has learned a lot and above all, he has gotten to know his customers and their needs. In order to sell his goods, he travels to different departments and cities in the north such as Somoto, Ocotal etc. According to his experience, there is a higher demand in those parts of the country.

As time has gone by, he has noticed that above all, dentists need someone to repair their equipment for them. This is why he has decided to earn a technical degree in the maintenance and repair of this kind of equipment. He is currently working towards this degree on the weekend in the city of Masatepe. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase several used pieces of equipment which he plans to repair in order to resell them. His goal is to go into dentistry and open his own dental office one day.

loans.use: Purchase of used dentistry equipment

loans.name: Reimundo Antonio

texts.es: Reimundo tiene su negocio que es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de de 6 años que tiene este negocio,  dedica a la comercialización de granos básicos, pues siempre se ha dedicado a brindar los mejores servicios. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos ya que gracias al gran esfuerzo que realiza es que ha mantenido a su familia.  El motivo del crédito es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz y concentrado. El desea tener una pulpería grande, pues ha sido muy difícil cumplirlo pero con persistencia sabe que podría lograrlo.
texts.en: Reimundo has his own store which sells dry beans and grains. He has had this store for over six years now. He sells dry beans and grains there. He has always sought to provide excellent customer service. He is responsible for taking care of his two young children. This is not the first time he has requested a loan. Thanks to his hard work, he has been able to provide for his family. With this loan, he plans to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn and other items. He would like to have a bigger store one day. He hasn't been able to reach this goal so far but he knows that if he sticks with it, one day he will reach his goal.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for his store

loans.name: Iris Marianela

texts.es:
Iris de 36 años, comenzó criando pollos hace varios años atrás. Por la buena administración que le dio al negocio ahora es una microempresaria que vende y comprar pollos. 

 Ella realiza el trabajo con los pollos en la parte delantera de su casa, los comprar pequeños los cría con balanceado y después los mata para venderlos. Uno de sus otros ingresos es la venta de productos de belleza. Una de sus complicaciones es que en ocasiones sus animales se les enferman y tiene que comprarles vitaminas para que se mejoren. Pero ese no es impedimento para que ella continúe trabajando por eso quiere comprar para el negocio maíz, balanceado y vitaminas. 

En el futuro quiere tener un gallinero y espacio suficiente para construir una casa en la parte de frene donde vive.
texts.en:
Iris, who is 36 years old, began raising chickens several years ago. Through the good management she applied to the business, she is now a small businesswoman who buys and sells chickens. She does her work with the chickens in the area in front of her house. She buys them when they are small, raises them on feed, and then kills them to sell. 

Another source of income for her is the sale of beauty products. One of her problems is that sometimes her animals become sick and she has to buy vitamins to make them well. But this does not deter her from her work, and therefore she wants to purchase corn, feed and vitamins. 

In the future she would like to have a henhouse and space enough to build a house in front of her current dwelling.

loans.use: Purchase feed and corn.

loans.name: Mary Mercedes

texts.es: Mary Mercedes se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, inicio a este negocio desde hace 7 años esto fue con el propósito de obtener una fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos. Ella siempre ha sido una Madre muy abnegada y responsable. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ofrecer un buen servicio y además le gusta interactuar con sus clientes, ya que es su medio de vida. El crédito es para la compra de materia necesaria como perfumes, cremas, tratamientos, pintura de uñas entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Mary Mercedes started selling cosmetics 7 years ago with the goal of having a source of income for her children. She has always been a responsible and selfless mother. She has always been known for offering good service and besides she likes to interact with her customers since it's her way of life. The loan is to buy necessary items such as perfumes, creams, treatments, nail polish, and other things.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: La Cumbre Group

texts.es: Doña Maria C. P.. D. 32 Años, es la presidenta, tiene 5 Hijos, 2 D. sus Hijos van a la escuela, ella se dedica especialmente al comercio compra y venta D. consumo diario en la plaza D. Pologua Momostenango, el grupo son Tres integrantes  una  D. ellas se dedica a la venta D. refacion: arroz en leche y Chocolate. Necesitan ampliar sus producción D. animales y también la venta D. consumo diario, por lo que se acercaron a las oficinas D. la asociación ASDIR D. pologuá, para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y D. sus familias. Este grupo D. señoras, son personas que se conocen muy bien, desD. hace 10 años han trabajado siempre juntas, en el cual lo integran D. la siguiente manera.
texts.en: The group has three members, including Doña María C. P., who is 32, is the president. She has 5 children, 2 of whom are in school. Her business is buying and selling food in the Pologua Momostenango plaza. Another member sells snacks: rice pudding and chocolate. They need to increase their animals' production as well as their food sales, so they came to the ASDIR Association offices in Pologuá for financing for their businesses, so they can improve the quality of life for themselves and their families. This group of ladies know each other well, having worked together for the last 10 years, and will continue to do so.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, agradece la oportunidad de mejorar su inventario en el negocio. Su actividad es la venta de frutas y verduras,  inicio a este negocio desde hace 15 años, debido a que su mama le había enseñado anteriormente este medio de vida siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar y así proporcionar una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia.  El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de limones, naranjas, mandarinas, melones entre otros.
texts.en: Rosa Maria has been working with the Fundación León 2000 for a long time, and is grateful for the opportunity it provides to improve her business. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for 15 years, a trade she learned from her mother. She is always looking for ways to improve her business and offer her family a better life. She has requested this loan to buy limes, oranges, tangerines, melons, and other produce.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Libertad

texts.es:
La señora Libertad es socia del banco comunal Mujeres solidarias distrito de calleria departamento de Ucayali, tiene 65 años de edad y está casada.
Libertad tiene una tienda de abarrotes muy bien surtida porque todos los préstamos que sacó en estos últimos años lo está invirtiendo en su negocio.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará abarrotes como 3 cajas de leche,  1 caja de mantequilla, 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 2 bolsas de fideos tallarín, 2 bolsas de fideos para sopa, 1 paquete de harina preparada, 1 caja de aceite, 5 paquetes de papel higiénico, 1 paquete de sal, 2 cajas de galletas, 2 bolsas de caramelo, 1 bolsa de tofi, etc.
La señora Libertad, a los años que tiene, todavía tiene las ganas de seguir trabajando para mantenerse activa, ya que ésto la hace sentirse bien de salud.

Ella nos dice que "...gracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio ha ido mejorando cada día".
texts.en:
Libertad is a member of the Mujeres Solidarias village bank in Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 65 years old and married.
Libertad has a well-stocked grocery store because she's invested all the loans she's taken out in recent years in building her business.
She will use this loan of 3000 nuevos soles to buy groceries such as 3 boxes of milk, 1 box of butter, 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 2 bags of spaghetti, 2 bags of soup noodles, 1 bag of flour, 1 box of oil, 5 packs of toilet paper, 1 box of salt, 2 boxes of cookies, 2 bags of candy, 1 bag of toffee, etc.
Despite her age, Libertad wants to keep working and stay active, since it makes her feel healthier.

She tell us that "...thanks to Manuela Ramos her business has been improving every day."

loans.use: Purchase groceries

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr:
Coiffeuse de  carrière depuis 15ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2enfants. Après son échec au brevet d’études secondaire, elle a préférer apprendre la coiffure pour éviter  l’oisiveté.
Avant de connaître  notre organisme, elle effectuait déjà des petites épargnes en faisant des ristournes et les cartes de pointages. Le premier prêt, lui a apprit beaucoup en gestion et épargnes. Elle procède à faire des prix promotionnels pour attirer ses clientes.

Ses revenus journaliers étaient de 10.000f avant le premier prêt, maintenant avec sa politique de rabais de tarif coiffure, pédicure , et manucure, elle a augmentée ses revenus jusqu'à  30000f 

Au prochain prêt, elle veut améliorer ses conditions de travail, car elle veut ajouter un casque pour les bains d’huile et une gamme complet de soins capillaires.
Très ambitieuse, Blandine compte faire l’extension de son salon en recrutant des filles mères pour leurs épanouissements.

Ses enfants sont en bas âges et mérite une attention particulière, elle se bat pour leurs donner une bonne éducation.
texts.en:
With a 15-year career as a hairdresser, Blandine is a married woman and the mother of two children. After failing to earn her middle school diploma, she favored learning how to style hair, so as to be active in life.  Before becoming familiar with our organization, she had already saved some money through the use of rebates and point cards.  The first loan taught her a lot about managing and saving money.  She continued on with promotional pricing to attract customers.  Her daily revenues amounted to 10,000 francs before her first loan.  And now, with her policy of discounts on the price of a haircuts, pedicures, and manicure, she has increased her revenues to 30,000 francs.  

For the next loan, Blandine wants to improve her work situation.  She wants to add headgear for providing oil treatments and a complete range of hair care.  A very ambition woman, she plans on expanding her salon by recruiting young mothers and developing them.  

Blandine's children are young and deserve special attention.  She struggles to given them a good education.

loans.use: Buying cosmetics and hair care products

loans.name: Jesenia

texts.es:
La señora Jesenia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, del distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene en su poder 1 hijo menor de edad.
La señora Jesenia se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir por catálogo, lleva tres años dedicada a su negocio que es rentable y que ha sabido manejarlo adecuadamente orientada por las charlas educativas que dan las promotoras y que las socias toman en cuenta para mejorar como persona y empresaria.

Con éste préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, comprará 5 conjunto de ropa interior, 2 calzones fajas, 5 pares de medias para damas, 6 bóxer para caballeros y 2 fajas.
La señora Jesenia tiene la oportunidad de poder tener en stock sus productos porque cuenta con un capital de trabajo y lo ha sabido distribuir de buena manera.
Como muchas mujeres, ella agradece a Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad que le sigue dando hasta el momento.
texts.en:
Jesenia is a member of the Mujeres Solidarias village bank in Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 36 years, married, and cares for one young son.
Jesenia has sold clothing from a catalog for three years and finds it profitable. She's been able to do well thanks to the training she's received on ways to improve as a person and as a businesswoman.

With this loan of 2000 nuevos soles, she will buy 5 sets of lingerie, 2 pairs of control briefs, 5 pairs of pantyhose, 6 pairs of men's boxers, and 2 girdles.
Jesenia has been able to have her merchandise on hand, since she's got some working capital and has known how to use it wisely.
Like many women, she is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the opportunities it continues to provide her.

loans.use: Purchase underwear

loans.name: Alba Maria

texts.es:
Alba de 41 años, es una microempresaria que en la actualidad tiene una tienda de víveres. Con dedicación y una buena administración ha podido mantener su negocio durante varios años. 

Su tienda la tiene surtida con arroz, azúcar, bebidas, legumbres, enlatados etc. Trabaja en la tienda desde las 06h00am hasta las 21:30pm. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere continuar surtiendo la tienda. Pero para ello necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, legumbres etc. 

En el futuro quiere vender frutas a través de su tienda y así comprar una casa y un carro para transportase y tener su propia cadena de frutas.
texts.en:
Alba, 41, is a micro businesswoman who currently has a grocery store.  With dedication and good administration she’s managed to stay in business for several years.

Her store is stocked with rice, sugar, beverages, vegetables, canned goods, etc.  She is open for business from 6am to 9:30pm.  She has many hopes for her business so she always wants to continue stocking it.  For this she needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, vegetables, etc.

In the futures she’d like to sell fruit in her store and thus buy a house and a car to transport herself and have her own chain of fruit stores.

loans.use: For rice and sugar.

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
La señora Ida es socia del banco comunal Mujeres solidarias, del distrito de Callería, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad.
Lleva 12 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo: cosméticos y perfumería.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de más productos; 5 colonias, 3 potes de crema, 3 champús, 2 colonias para hombre, 2 lociones para después de afeitarse, 5 labiales, 2 rubores, 2 sombras. 3 lápiz delineadores y 5 esmaltes.
La señora Ida vende sus productos para poder sentirse útil y pueda comprarse algunas cosas que ella necesita, gracias a sus ventas ella puede aportar para los gastos de su hogar.
"Manuela ramos les da la oportunidad de poder trabajar a todas las mujeres que lo desean".
texts.en:
Ida is a member of the Mujeres Solidarias communal bank in Callería district, Ucayali department.  She is 60 years old, married and has four adult children.

She has been collaborating with Manuela Ramos for 12 years.  She sells products via catalogue: cosmetics and perfumes.

She will use this 2500 new sol loan to buy more products: 5 colognes, 3 jars of cream, 3 shampoos, 2 men’s colognes, 2 after shave lotions, 5 lipsticks, 2 blushes, 2 eye shadows, 3 eyeliner pencils and 5 nail polishes.

Ida sells her products to feel useful and to be able to buy a few things she needs.  Thanks to her sales she’s able to contribute to household expenses.

“Manuela Ramos gives all the women who want to work the opportunity to do so.”

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell via catalogue.

loans.name: Javier De Jesus

texts.es: Javier de Jesús se dedica a brindar el servicio de negocio de venta de medicamentos, los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante. hace más de 9 años que tiene este negocio, es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor ya que a su edad siempre le ha gustado esforzarse por mejorar su condición de vida disfruta mucho de su trabajo a pesar de que algunas veces es muy difícil.  Es así que el motivo del crédito lo realiza para la compra de frascos, pastillas, suplementos entre otros encargos que tiene pendiente.  La meta de Jesús es seguir creciendo con su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Javier de Jesús is an itinerant medicinal products salesman.  He’s been in this line of work for over 9 years.  He is a very hard working, enterprising man who, at his age, has always enjoyed making the effort to improve his living conditions.  He enjoys his work very much even though it is sometimes very difficult.

The reason for the loan is to buy jars, pills, supplements and others for which he has pending orders.  His goal is to continue growing in his business and to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy stock items for his sales.

loans.name: Jesmin

texts.es:
La señora Jesmin es socia del banco comunal María Montessori, del distrito de Manantay y Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 31 años, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Jesmin tiene un negocio de pasamanería, ya tiene varios años trabajando y los préstamos que sacó de Manuela Ramos le han servido para incrementar mas su negocio, la mercadería la trae de la ciudad de Lima, para poder obtener mejores precios y mayores  ganancias.

La señora Jesmin invertirá su nuevo préstamo de S/.2,500.00 nuevos soles en la compra de 1 doc. de ganchos, ½ ciento de peines, ½ ciento de espejos, 1 paquete de cintas de colores, 1 ciento de adornos, 1 ciento de aplicaciones, 2 cientos de botones de diferentes tamaños y modelos.
La señora  Jesmin trabaja al igual que su esposo para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y para lograr, más adelante, dar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Jesmin is a member of the María Montessori communal bank in Mantantay district, Ucayali department.  She is 31 years old, married and has a son.

Jesmin sells notions and has been working for several years.  Loans she took out at Manuela Ramos have helped her increase her business still more.  She brings her merchandise from the city of Lima in order to get better prices and higher profits.

Jesmin will use her new 2500 new sol loan to buy a dozen hooks, 50 combs, 50 mirrors, 1 package of colored ribbons, 100 decorations, 100 appliqués, 200 buttons in assorted sizes and styles.

Jesmin works just like her husband to be able to meet household expenses and to manage later on to provide their son with a good education.

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise like hooks, zippers, combs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Marina

texts.fr:
