Hace 19 años, Leticia que abrió un restaurante y le puso de nombre “Kutimuy” (termino en quechua que significa “Regresa”). Leticia prepara desayuno, almuerzo y cena para a unos 80 clientes. El restaurante se encuentra equipado con sillas y mesas y muchas cosas básicas. Leticia trabaja los 7 días de la semana, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Leticia requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo azúcar, arroz, fideos y aceite. 

Ya son cuatro años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien gracias a la confianza de sus compañeros y a la puntualidad de los pagos que realiza. 
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Leticia was born in the city of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department. She belongs to “Las Margarita Ocongate” (The Ocongate Daisies) communal bank. Leticia currently lives in her hometown with her husband and their three children. (Ocongate is about two hours away from the city of Cusco.)

19 years ago, Leticia opened a restaurant and named it “Kutimuy” (a Quechua word meaning "Come back"). Leticia makes breakfast, lunch and dinner for about 80 customers. The restaurant is equipped with chairs and tables and many basic items. Leticia works 7 days a week from 7 in the morning until 9 at night. Leticia needs the loan to buy more supplies such as sugar, rice, noodles and oil.

She has been a member of the communal bank for four years now, and she is doing very well thanks to the her companions' reliability and to their punctuality in making their payments.
    
She is very grateful for the opportunity given her through this medium, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Buy more supplies like sugar, rice, noodles and oil

loans.name: Sabas Daniel

texts.es:
Don Sabas P., tiene 45 anos de edad, habita en la comunidad Laguneta, del Municipio de Pueblo Nuevo, del Departamento de Jinotega, al norte de Esteli, casado, tiene 4 hijos y se dedica a la siembra de Hortalizas y Granos Basicos.
Inicio en este negocio, con un tio, el le ayudo y le explico como se sembraba, ademas el tio tenia un terreno. Pero por problemas financieros, viajo al vecino pais de Costa Rica a buscar mejor futuro para el y su familia, hace 8 anos, vivio 2 anos alla y regreso a su patria.
Intento tener dos negocios a la vez, una era una ventecita y el otro era la agricultura, pero tuvo que cerrar la venta porque la descapitalizo por invertir en la agricultura.
Luego se dedico solamente a la agricultura, y paso muchos problemas de sequia y otras condiciones de la naturaleza que no le fueron tan favorables. Pero poco a poco fue superando estos problemas, tanto asi, que ahora cuenta con su propio equipo de riego.
Solicito este credito, para la siembra de 1/2 manzana de Tomate.
Su meta es poder administrar bien sus recursos para poder producir Hortalizas durante todo el ano, y asi no verse en la necesidad de eimgrar a otro pais.
texts.en:
Don Sabas P., 45, lives in the community of Laguneta in the municipality of Pueblo Nuevo in the Jinotega department, north of Esteli.  He is married, has 4 children, and is a farmer who cultivates vegetables and staple grains.

He started in this business with his uncle.  He helped his uncle, and his uncle taught him how to farm.  In addition, his uncle had his own land.  But 8 years ago, because of financial problems, he traveled to the neighboring country of Costa Rica, seeking a better future for himself and for his family.  He lived there for 2 years, and then returned to his native country.

He tried to have 2 businesses at once: one was a small sales stand and another was farming.  But he had to close the sales business because it left him without the capital he needed to invest in his farming business.  

So later, he worked only in agriculture, and he experienced many problems with drought and other natural conditions that were not very favorable.  But gradually he overcame these problems, so much so that now he has his own irrigation equipment.

He requests a loan to plan a 1/2 manzana (a little less than an acre) of tomatoes.

His goal is to be able to manage his resources well so that he can produce vegetables all year long, and so avoid having to emigrate to another country.

loans.use: farming (vegetables)

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda nació en la ciudad de Ocongate provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco. Actualmente, Clorinda vive en la ciudad donde nació junto con su esposo y sus hijos. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Hace 13 años, Clorinda  que se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, ella en su domicilio tiene un galpón donde aproximadamente tiene 300 cuyes, ella vende a S/. 20 nuevos soles cada cuy ya se ha preparado o vivo, ella vende a dueños de restaurantes, vecinos y amigos.  Al lado de su casa, Clorinda tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra pasto y alfalfa que sirven de alimento para los animales. La pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana en su domicilio. Clorinda requiere el crédito para comprar semillas y abono.
texts.en:
Clorinda was born in the city of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department. She belongs to “Las Margarita Ocongate” (The Ocongate Daisies) communal bank with Arariwa Cusco. Clorinda currently lives in her hometown with her husband and children. (Ocongate is about two hours away from the city of Cusco.)

For 13 years, Clorinda has raised small animals like guinea pigs. She has a shed at home where she has approximately 300 guinea pigs. She sells them for 20 new soles each, either cooked or live. She sells them to restaurant owners, neighbors and friends. On the side of her house, Clorinda has several fields where she grows grass and alfalfa to feed the animals. She can be found at home seven days per week.  Clorinda needs the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila nació en la ciudad de Ocongate provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco. Actualmente, Luzmila vive en la ciudad donde nació junto con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Luzmila tiene una tienda donde vende productos agro veterinarios como por ejemplo abono que sirve para los terrenos de cultivos y también tiene  un hospedaje con cinco cuartos. La pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana en su domicilio. 
 
Con el próximo préstamo que Luzmila va recibir S/. 2000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar urea.
texts.en:
Luzmila was born in the city of Ocongate in the Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.  She belongs to the “Las Margaritas Ocongate” (The Ocongate Daisies) Communal Bank with the Cusco Arariwa association.

Luzmila currently lives with her husband and their four children in the city where she was born.  (The city of Ocongate is located two hours from the city of Cusco).

Luzmila has a store where she sells farming and veterinary products.  For example, she sells fertilizer to use on fields where crops grow.  She also has a boarding house with five rooms.  You can find her at her house seven days of the week.

Luzmila will receive 2,000 soles with her next loan.  She would like to use the money from the loan to buy urea.

loans.use: To buy urea

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
Benigno nació en la ciudad de Carhuayo y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la Asociación Arariwa. Actualmente, Benigno vive en la ciudad de Ocongate junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Actualmente, Benigno trabaja en la municipalidad de Ocongate como asistente del teniente alcalde. Ya son 5 años que trabaja en la municipalidad y le va muy bien. Benigno se encuentra en su oficina de la municipalidad, los 6 días de semana, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. 

Hace 12 años, Benigno que se dedica a la producción de truchas, el tiene 8 pozas de agua en su domicilio donde se encuentra las truchas. La idea de abrir este negocio fue cuando la municipalidad del lugar decidido dar charlas de capacitación acerca de la crianza de truchas. Benigno vio en este tema una gran oportunidad para dedicarse al negocio, al principio le fue complicado pero ahora es un hábil productor de truchas. Benigno vende sus truchas a sus amigos, vecinos, a gente que tiene restaurantes y a otras más. Benigno y su esposa también preparan trucha al horno para las personas que vienen a visitar su granja. Benigno quiere dedicarse solamente a distribución y venta de crías de truchas a diferentes piscigranjas de la zona de Ocongate. Benigno requiere el préstamo para comprar más crías de truchas.
texts.en: Benigno was born in the city of Carhuayo and is a part of the Communal Bank “Las Margarita Ocongate” of the Arariwa association. Benigno currently lives in the city of Ocongate with his wife and 2 children. (The city of Ocongate is located 2 hours from the city of Cusco). Currently, Benigno works in the municipality of Ocongate as an assistant deputy mayor. He has worked in the municipality for 5 years and it is going very well. Benigno is in the office 6 days a week from 8:00 a.m. until 5 p.m. For 12 years, Benigno has been raising trout. He has 8 pools of water in his home where he keeps the trout. The idea of starting this business was when the local municipality decided to give training lectures about raising trout. Benigno saw in this a great opportunity to work in this business. In the beginning it was difficult but now he is a skilled producer of trout. Benigno sells trout to his friends, neighbors, restaurant owners, and others. Benigno and his wife also prepare baked trout for people who come to visit their farm. Benigno wants to devote himself solely to the distribution and sale of baby trout at different fish farms in the Ocongate area. Benigno needs a loan to buy more baby trout.

loans.use: To buy more baby trout

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
Yoni nació en la ciudad de Marcapata provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Yoni vive en la ciudad Ocongate junto con su esposo y su hija de un año. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Yoni es una mujer joven y humilde que tiene 24 años, ella abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y está ubicado en la calle Libertad de la ciudad de Ocongate. La pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10  de la noche en su tienda. 
 
Yoni requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos  y muchas cosas más que falta en la tienda. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Yoni was born in the city of Marcapata in the Quispicanchis providence and Cusco department. She currently lives in the city of Ocongate with her husband and one year old daughter. (The city of Ocongate is located two hours from the city of Cusco). Yoni is a humble young woman who is 24 years old. She opened a small grocery store that is located on Liberty street ("Libertad") in the city of Ocongate. You can find her working in her store 7 days a week from 8:00 a.m. until 10 p.m. Yoni needs a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, noodles, and much more that is missing from the store. She is grateful for the opportunity afforded and agrees to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use:
para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más que falta en la tienda. 

To buy goods such as rice, sugar, noodles and much more that is missing from the store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, maestra, originaria del departamento de Totonicapán ella esta solicitando su segundo crédito en Asociación Asdir, es una persona responsable que se ha encontrado al día en sus créditos anteriores y necesita de esta ayuda para cubrir gastos de estudio.
texts.en: Margarita is 25 years old and single.  She is a teacher and is from the department of Totonicapán.  She is requesting her second loan with Asociación Asdir.  She is a responsible person and her previous loans are up to date.  She needs this loan to cover her education expenses.

loans.use: Education expenses

loans.name: Sanjaa

texts.en:
Sanjaa is 27, single and lives with her five year old son in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She has lived in her current apartment, which was given to her by her parents, for 15 years. 

Sanjaa sells cosmetics at a rented kiosk in a trading center. She started her business in July 2010 after gaining experience working as a store salesperson from 2005 to 2010. Sanjaa is able to run her business successfully due to her previous experience. She started her business with the working capital of 1,500,000 MNT and her current working capital exceeds 2,000,000 MNT. Sanjaa is a hardworking and calm person who wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Fanor Efren

texts.es:
El Senor Fanor Z., habita en la Comarca El Coyolito, esta casado, tien 6 hijos, con mas de 20 anos de expieriencia en las actividades agricolas.
Inicio con su Papa a muy corta edad, el recuerda que tenia aproximadamente unos 5 anos de edad cuando comenzo a trabajar con el, en todas las labores de la Finca. Al mismo tiempo estudiaba, algo que no fue nada facil, pues el colegio mas cercano estaba a unos 3 kms de su casa, pero no pudo terminar como el hubiese deseado, pues a penas llego a 6to grado de primaria.
Recuerda que a los 12 anos, sembro su primer manzana de Repollo
Luego con lo que fue recogiendo de sus cosechas, se caso y se independizo de sus padres, y compro un pequeno terreno, poco apoco fue haciendo su casita.
Se dedica actualmente un poco a la ganaderia y a la agricultura, con siembra de Granos Basicos y Hortalizas.
Su meta es lograr que sus hijos se preparen para que ellos puedan tener un nivel de vida mucho mejo que el.
Realizo este credito para la siembra de Repollo.
texts.en:
Fanor Z. lives in the El Coyolito region. He is married with six children and has more than 20 years of experience working in agriculture. He began working alongside his father at a vey young age. He remembers being around 5 years old when he began to help him with all the farm activities. At the same time Fanor was studying, which was not easy for him since his school was around three kilometeres from his home. He could not finish his schooling like he wanted to, leaving after Grade 6 of primary school.

Fanor remembers that at the age of 12 he sowed his first block of land with cabbage. Later, when he was able to support himself with his harvests, he married and moved out of his parents' home. He bought a small block of land and bit by bit he built a home. 

Fanor is currently breeding cattle and working in agriculture, sowing legumes and vegetables. His goal is to bring up his children to have a much better quality of life than his own. He will use this loan to sow cabbage.

loans.use: Sow vegetables and cabbage

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle B. is from the city of Tinago Ozamiz City. She is 25 years old and single. To make a living, Michelle owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food and drinks in the local community. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Michelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Michelle's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nasandelger

texts.en:
Nasandelger, 35, is married and lives with his wife and two sons in the Bayanhongor Province of Mongolia. They live in a ger (Mongolian nomadic housing tent). His wife works as a salesperson for a company and his oldest son attends a local primary school. He started a transportation service business with his brother in 2000. In 2007, he began a wholesale trading business specializing in flour and rice which are loaded on a 20-ton container. 

Now, he drives a car at Tavan Tolgoi, the biggest coal mine in Mongolia, located close to the Chinese border. He is a hard-working and modest person who says, "I am planning to build a house on my land that I bought three years ago. Therefore, I have to make more money. But in the future, I am thinking to operate a stable business in order to take care of my health." 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to help pay for the necessary spare parts and for maintenance costs for his car. His truck must be maintained properly in order for him to obtain income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase necessary spare parts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth M., 37, lives in Monterico, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, where she and her husband, a farmer, have three children. In order to help her husband while at home, she decided to raise pigs for an additional source of income. She also buys and sells goods such as root crops, vegetables and anything else just to earn a living.

Elizabeth became a micro entrepreneur because of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. This co-op teaches women how to develop their own businesses to support their spouses’ incomes. She has thus far been able to obtain a loan and now is requesting 5,000 PHP to buy feed and piglets. Her husband is very supportive of her endeavours.

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Mrs. Esmeralda D. is 64 and widowed with six adult children. She lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Esmeralda has experienced difficulties being a single parent, but has found ways to survive. She runs a sari-sari (general store) that she started with with a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). Esmeralda has been able to successfully manage her business and it covers her daily consumption needs. Esmeralda is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store. She wishes that her business will grow with the help of God who provides our needs. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao, reaching out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: to purchase general store goods

loans.name: Alpenita

texts.en:
Mrs. Alpenita A. is 41 years old and married with a school-aged child. She lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City. Alpenita believes in determination and hard work and runs a sari-sari (general) store. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative last July to avail herself of its loan facilities. The coop teaches its members to have a “livelihood project,” or business, to become productive and self-reliant. Alpenita’s dream is to own a mini grocery store someday where her neighbors can come to buy items such as rice, oil, sauce, sugar and candy. Today, Alpenita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase good for her sari-sari store. She hopes and prays to God that she will always be blessed with good health.  

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao, reaching out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase store inventory

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace R. is from the city of Lam-an Ozamiz City. She is 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Grace owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. In the dry season, she wants to grow rice two times a year, so she needs some money to support this. To improve their farming, Mrs. Sopheap V. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, pesticide and to plow the rice field. Through this activity, they support three children who are enrolled in a local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman who lives in Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a dried fish vending business. Her husband Joven B., who is 38 years old, works as a security guard to earn his living. They have 3 children who are 13 to 19 years old. 

Marissa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marissa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10000, uplifting her family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 20000, which she intends to use to buy more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's education, house repairs, and home appliances. Marissa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Her husband, Mr. Tong Un, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell. Besides farming, he is also a basket maker.

Loem wants to buy a new motorbike for use by her family, yet her savings is not enough. So to achieve this purpose, Mrs. Loem T. is requesting a loan to buy a new motorbike. Her husband is in the picture with her.

La señora Enma H. V. se dedica a la venta de tuberculos en el mercado toledo hace más de cinco años aproximadamente, La solicitante vive en casa alquilada con su hija el cual está en la Universidad estatal de la ciudad de Ica . Está solicitando el crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando mercadería de todo tipo.
Se propone otorgarle el crédito por que presenta buena experiencia acrediticia en otras entidades bancarias y también presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Enma H. V. has been selling tubers in the Toledo market for more than 5 years, approximately.  She lives in a rented home with her daughter who attends the state university in the city of Ica.  She is asking for a loan to invest in her business, buying merchandise of all types.  

The loan was offered to her because she has a good credit history with other banks and also presents good personal and work references.

texts.en:
Lilybeth S. is 33 years old and married. She supports her family by operating a used clothing business and a tricycle transport business. She lives in Maasin, Brookes Point, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her used clothing and tricycle transport businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. 

Lilybeth is now borrowing PHP 17,000 so that she can continue to purchase more stocks of used clothes to sell. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lilybeth aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

Therefore, he is asking for his second loan of $1,000 to buy a Tuk Tuk (a three-wheeled motorcycle or moto-rickshaw). The Tuk Tuk is not forbidden.

She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $137 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Medelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. 

She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sapa Luboc, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: pig fattening and dressmaking. Her 52-year-old husband, Feliciano, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have five children who are between 11 and 29 years old. Tessie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Tessie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,200, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for the pigs. She wants to continue to save up for the future education of her children. Tessie is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase feeds, medicines and vaccines for pigs

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina B. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 56 years old. Martina is a widow and has twp adult-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs to sell. She is just starting this business.

In 2011, Martina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en:
Rithy H., 19, is single and lives with her sisters and mother along National Road Number 1 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

She sells clothes in the Phnom Penh market and takes motor taxis very often. Taking a motor taxi to the market is expensive for the family. 

Hence she is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Chiva

texts.en:
Mrs. Chiva N. and her husband, Mr. Set Sary, live along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2006 and have a young daughter.

Chiva is now a garment factory worker. Her husband drives a Tuk Tuk (a motocycle taxi). They also grow jujube on the farmland in the village.  

But Set’s Tuk Tuk is old and breaks often; he spends a lot of money to repair it. Hence Chiva is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new one for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a new Tuk Tuk

loans.name: Marilou's Group

texts.en: Marilou G. is from the village of Brgy. Escoting, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 28 years old. Marilou is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Marilou is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish in the market. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en: Felicisima is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: firewood, used clothing and pig fattening. Her 58-year-old husband, Julio, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 23 and 32 years old. Felicisima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Felicisima has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,900, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy new equipment for farming so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of her business. Felicisima is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.use: Purchase new equipment for farming

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Mrs. Channy E., 46, is a widow with one son and five daughters. Three of her children are garment factory workers, one is learning tailoring skills and the other two are in school. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. 

Channy runs a grocery store at home. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to get to work

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is a married woman who lives in Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and feeds and fish vending. Her 35-year-old husband, Alberto I. III, works as a casual employee to earn his living. They have four children who are between 4 and 12 years old. Rhoda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rhoda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3200, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she could continue to save up for future house improvements and family needs. Rhoda is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Kiev

texts.en:
Mrs. Kiev S. lives in Ta Vong village in Takeo province and she was born in 1952. 

She is the mother of two children who are laborers and they are helping their parents’ businesses. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family and she owns an agricultural machine that she hires to villagers to get some extra income.

Her husband, Mr. Koem Yan Sim, is a policeman who gets a low salary to support his family. He is also a motorbike taxi driver. 

Currently, she has a problem because the trailer for her agricultural machine is too old to use. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Kiev S. is asking for a loan to buy another a trailer. 

Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a new trailer

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en: Robelyn L. is from the village of Brgy. Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 32 years old. Robelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Robelyn plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Robelyn has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Robelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Robelyn is requesting a new loan of 34,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Robelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yem S. is a villager in Trapeang Trach village in Takeo province, and she was born in 1971. 

She is a farmer who owns a 1.3-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. She is also a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Sakun Khen, is a construction worker. 

Mrs. Yem S. is bringing up five children. Two are seamstresses in garment factories, two are studying in the local public school, and the other is helping her to do business. 

Although both parents try to work hard, they can earn only a little income. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Yem S. is applying for a loan to add to her savings in order to buy two cows for breeding to start a new business. 

Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma V. is from the village of Brgy. Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old. Vilma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2011, Vilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Vilma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Melany has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2011, Melany joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melany is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Melany from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. loans.name: Chimed

texts.en:
Chimed, 37, is married and lives with his wife and three sons in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a rented house. They used to live in a small village and came to the province center four years ago. Two of his sons attend local primary school. 

He started his clothing business in 2007. Now he sells different types of clothing at an outdoor stall at a local market. His sister helps him to purchase clothing from Erlian, the closest border city of China. As he has gained enough experience in the clothing business, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks to purchase more clothing for his business. His wife says, "We want to expand our business and buy a house where we can have a comfortable life with our children."

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena P. is from the village of Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old. Magdalena is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Magdalena raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising ducks to produce and sell eggs. Magdalena has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Magdalena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase medication for her livestock. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Magdalena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase medication for her livestock

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Samy

texts.en: Mrs. Samy N. is a widow with two children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other is still in school. She lives in Angk Ta Nu village, which is located in Takeo province. She makes a living by running a general store where she generates enough money to support her family. Her business is going well, and Mrs. Samy N. wants to expand it by securing a loan to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Pin

texts.en: Mrs. Pin S. lives in Samna Khmau village in Takeo province, where she was born in 1970. She and her husband, Mr. Thy Soem, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land where they support their family by growing rice. Mr. Thy Soem also works in construction, but unfortunately his job is located far from their home and farm. To help ease his commute, Mrs. Pin S. is applying for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband. The couple has five children, one of whom works in a garment factory. Another works in construction, two are in public school and one is too young to go to school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Mrs. Channa N. is a married and has four children, all of whom attend a local public school. They also spend time working on the family's farm. She was born in 1974 and lives in Damnak Reachea village, which is located in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Sor, own a three-hectare plot of land where they grow rice and vegetables, which they make a living by selling. Mr. Bunthoeun Sor also works in construction. The family has a problem because their farm has a lot of insects. To increase her production of rice, Mrs. Channa N. is applying for a loan to buy pesticide. She will also use a portion of this loan to hire workers to help her to do her farming.

loans.use: To buy pesticide for a rice and vegetable farm

loans.name: Korb

texts.en: Mrs. Korb A. lives in Svay Thum village in Takeo province, where she was born in 1979. She is a farmer who owns a three-hectare plot of land where she supports her family by growing rice. It is time for her to plow her fields and plant a new crop, but she does not have enough oxen to complete the work. That is why she is applying for a loan to buy a new ox to help with plowing. Her husband, Mr. Tor Pork, is a construction worker and a fisherman, and the couple has four children, three of whom are in local public schools. Their youngest child, who is six years old, has not yet begun school. In the photo, we see Mrs. Korb A. with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a new ox

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en: Mrs. Sambo Y. has a full-time job in a hotel in Phnom Penh, and her husband works as a teacher. She owns one motorbike (which we see in the photo) which her husband uses to drive to school everyday. She is applying for her first loan, for $600, to buy a second motorbike for her own commute. The family lives about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 1998 and have two daughters, both of whom are in school.

loans.use: To buy a second motorbike to use to commute to work.

loans.name: Vannarith

texts.en:
Mr. Vannarith E. (pictured here) is 43 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sokunthearin In is 32 years old. They have been married since 1992 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. They live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Vannarith is a soldier, and his wife is a garment factory worker. He is applying for his first loan of $500 to repair the house where he lives.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Mrs. Lon S. lives in Trapeang Reang village in Takeo province and she was born in 1970. She is a vegetable seller at a local market, where she is able to earn some profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chantha Loem, is a pig middleman, who is also able to earn some money to support his family.

Since her husband’s business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So, with this purpose in mind, Mrs. Lon S. is requesting a loan to buy more pigs for resale. She is a mother of five children, one of whom is a laborer, three are studying in the local public school, and the smallest one is only 2 years old. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for resale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn S. is from the village of Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 30 years old. Jocelyn is married and has an infant. To make a living, Jocelyn raises pigs for breeding. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2011, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Doeur

texts.en:
Mrs. Doeur Y. and her husband, Mr. Hean Koev, are farmers who own a 2-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. She breeds pigs as well. They both live in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province.

They have a problem with the rice field, because the soil is infertile, it is far away from irrigation, and it has a lot of insects. So, to improve production of rice, Mrs. Doeur Y. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, pesticide, and to hire farm laborers to do farming. She is raising four children, three of whom are studying in the local public school, but the youngest one is only 2 years old. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, pesticide.

loans.name: Ing

texts.en:
Mrs. Ing L. (pictured with her husband) is 43 years old and her husband, Mr. Doeun Mun is 45 years old, and live along the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One is a garment factory worker, one is hired to sell groceries in Phnom Penh, and another one is in school.
 
Ing is a weaver and her husband is a rice farmer and fisherman. Ing is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Mat

texts.en:
Mrs. Mat Y. lives in Prey Bay village in Takeo province and she was born in 1969. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. The dry season is the time for growing rice, so she needs some money to support this business.

Mrs. Mat Y. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to hire farm laborers. She will use the rest of the loan to add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding and start a new business. Her husband, Mr. Nat Mouv, is a laborer who is able to earn some money to support his family, too. Through this activity, the couple is raising three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, but the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to hire farm laborers.

loans.name: Rida

texts.en:
Mrs. Rida S. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Phally Bun, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have 3 young children: two sons and one daughter. 

Mrs. Rida S. sells finished silk fabric. She buys it from the fellow weavers in her village and transports it to sell at different places far away from her home. Her husband has full-time employment in Phnom Penh.

She hopes to continue expanding her business, so she is asking for another loan of $600 to purchase additional finished silk fabrics for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more finished silk fabric for resale.

loans.name: Pang

texts.en:
Mrs. Pang Y. lives in Prey Bay village, Takeo province, and she was born in 1960. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. She is also a pig breeder.

She has a problem with the rice field, because it has infertile soil. So, to improve production rice, Mrs. Pang Y. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, plow her rice field, and to hire farm laborers to grow rice. Her husband, Mr. Sok Sam, is a rice wine maker and he owns a mill where he earns some money to support his family. Through this activity, the couple is raising five children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, but the others attend a local public school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, and plow her rice field.

loans.name: On

texts.en:
Mrs. On C. (in the photo) and her husband are farmers; they grow vegetables and rice on their land in the village. Besides farming, she also has a new business selling silk fabric. She is asking for a loan of $1,000; she will use $350 to purchase a water pumping machine to spray her farm and another $650 to purchase silk fabrics for resale.

The family lives in a village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine and buy silk fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Soda

texts.en:
Mr. Soda M. (in the photo), 29, and his wife, Mrs. Uheng Kourch, have been married since 2002 and have two daughters. One is in school and the other is still young. The family lives along National Road Number Six about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Soda is a driver, and is hired to drive. His wife is a garment factory worker. He is requesting his first loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Yaem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yaem P. lives in Phngeas village in Takeo province and she was born in 1983. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family.

She has a problem with the rice field, because it is infertile. So, to improve the production of rice, Mrs. Yaem P. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, and to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for transportation. Her husband, Mr. Thou Nob, is a duck breeder who is able to earn some money from selling duck eggs to support his family. The couple is raising two children who are all too young to work or study. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan B. (in the photo) is 47 years old and her husband, Mr. Ol Saing is 46 years old. They have been married since 1987 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two are married, one is a garment factory worker, and the other three attend school. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Nan is a farmer; she grows sugar cane, tomatoes, and corn. Her husband constructs wooden houses. The house where she lives is old and is broken down in some parts, so she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to repair it.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Sreyoirn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyoirn C. (in the photo), 38, is single. She lives with her mother on an Island of Mekong River, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

She has been a weaver since she was young. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then in turn sells them in Phnom Penh market. She is asking for a loan of $100 to purchase weaving materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey P. was born in 1954 and she lives in Samphli village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3.50-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family and she also sells noodles in her local village.

She has a problem with the rice field, because it is time to grow the rice. So, to improve the production of rice, Mrs. Srey P. is seeking a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and plow the rice field. She is a widow with two children, two of whom are employed in garment factories.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and plow the rice field.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan S. is 49 years old and her husband, Mr. Sochea Hout, is 50 years old (pictured together), and they have been married since 1980 and have five daughters. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Kan and her husband are lotus farmers. They are requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase seed and fertilizer to maintain their lotus farm.

loans.use: To use for growing lotus.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. Say P., who was born in 1974, lives in Angkonh village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Somreth Som, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. He is a village chief too.

Currently, she wants to start a new business, but her savings is not enough. So, Mrs. Say P. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is raising four children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factories, and the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Ney

texts.en:
Mrs. Ney T. is a widow with four children, two of whom are farmers, one is a laborer, and the other is a student. They live in Prey Melong Khang Cheung village in Takeo province. She is a farm laborer and a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family.

It is time to cultivate the rice field, so she needs some money to support this activity. To improve the production rice, Mrs. Ney T. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and plow the rice field.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and plow the rice field

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Mrs. Phin P., who lives in Prey Melong Khang Cheung village in Takeo province, was born in 1958. She and her husband, Mr. Sang Suon, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. She also sells sugar cane and potatoes door-to-door.

Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So, Mrs. Phin P. is asking for a loan to buy more sugar cane and potatoes to resell. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are employed in garment factories, and the others attend the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy more sugar cane and potatoes.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en: Marion A. is from the village of Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old. Marion is single. To make a living, Marion raises pigs for breeding. Marion has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2011, Marion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marion is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Marion from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Leticia's Group

texts.en: Leticia P. is from the village of Brgy. Darubba, Quezon,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 59 years old. Leticia is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Leticia is widowed and has six adult children. To make a living, Leticia operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing rice processing to local community members. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leticia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Leticia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Yumjirlhan

texts.en:
Yumjirlhan, 40, is married and lives with her husband and two daughters in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they have owned for past 10 years. Her husband operates a transportation service business, in which he uses his own car. Both her children attend a local secondary school. 

Yumjirlhan started her meat trading business in 2001.  She operates from a stall at a local market. She purchases meat or livestock from individuals who bring them to her city, then sells the meat at her stall at the market. 

Yumjirlhan is a sociable person who says, "I am trying my best to make my business stable in order to create a constant source of income". She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more meat to sell at her stall.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Milo's Group

texts.en:
Milo P. is from the village of Brgy. Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. He is 46 years old. Milo is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Milo is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Milo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Milo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Milo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Milo is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Milo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Orifa

texts.ru: Шапоатова Орифа проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 45 лет. Она разведена, имеет одного ребенка. Образование средне – специальное, товаровед. Работает на центральном рынке района. Она в основном занимается торговлей детской одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Orifa Shopatova lives in the Vahdat region. She is 45 years old. She is divorced and has one child. She has specialized secondary education, she is a commodities expert. She works on the central market in the region. She mainly sells children's clothing. She has been in this business for twenty years. She is taking out the loan to increase sales volume.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is a resident of Faisalabad, a big city in Pakistan famous for its textile industry. She lives there with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of Mai de jughi. She moved here 17 years ago. Perveen is 45 years old, married to S. A. and has 4 children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Perveen is a caring woman, managing her household tasks with great responsibility by staying at home.

Perveen's husband has had a business selling scrap for the past 10 years. He provides scrap material to different factories and to other scrap dealers to earn an income for the family. Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase scrap such as used papers, plastic bottles, iron, etc. in bulk to help him complete his orders and make a good profit. Perveen is hopeful that an investment will have a good impact on the business and will earn her husband more income than before. Perveen is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who never missed a single meeting and who paid her installments on time.

Note: In the photo, the woman raising her hand is Perveen.

loans.use: to buy scrap materials

loans.name: Chinigul

texts.ru: Шапоатова Чинигул жительница района Вахдат. Ей 48 лет. Вдова, имеет одного ребенка. Она более 20 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает продукты питания. Кредит просит для покупки холодильника.
texts.en: Chinigul S. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 48 years old. She is a widow and has one child. She has been selling on the market for more than twenty years. She has a store where she sells food. She is asking for a loan to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рахмонов Рустам проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 42 года. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование-среднее. Более 10 лет занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает электрические товары и сувениры. В продвижении бизнеса ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Rustam R. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 42 years old. He is married and has two children. He has secondary education. For more than ten years Rustam has been selling goods. He has own store where he sells electrical appliances and souvenirs. His wife is helping him in the development of his business. He is asking for a loan to increase sales volume.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Sayyorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sayyorn S. (pictured here) is 29 years old and her husband, Mr. Chamreun Khat, is 30 years old. They have been married since 2005 and have two daughters, who are still young. The family lives along national road number one about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sayyorn sells meatballs and boiled eggs in her village. Her husband is a remoque taxi driver (a remoque is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back). She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To renovate the house where she lives.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He graduated from primary school. He has a shop selling cars equipment. The borrower will use this loan to purchase spare parts for various cars. He has a good reputation in the market. He sells good quality items to his clients at a sound price for the customers. He has an ambitious to develop his shop.

loans.use: For purchasing spare parts

loans.name: Elsa's Group

texts.en:
Elsa A. is from the village of Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old. Elsa is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elsa is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Elsa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Elsa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 20 years old and single. He graduated from primary school. He has a mini-market, and he will use this loan to develop his mini-market and purchase a refrigerator and various food products such as sugar, rice and tea. The borrower has a good character on the market. All the prices are reasonable and that makes lots of customers do their shopping at his mini-market. The borrower has a huge ambition to develop his business to raise his income.

loans.use: For purchasing products & a vertical fridge

loans.name: Asif

texts.ru:
Asif A. 20 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Asif jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Asif okonchil kolledj i uje 1 qod kak imeyet magazin qde prodayot produkti. Asif  etomu biznessu nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca , u yeqo otca bil sobstvenniy magazi Asif po nachalu pomoqal svoyemu otcu po rabote no potom reshil otkrit svoy magazin. 
Asif prodayet pishiviye produkti, no seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit moyushiye sredstva dlya pereprodaji tak kak na eto yest spros sredi pokupateley.
texts.en: Asif A. is twenty years old. He is not married and does not have children. Asif lives in the city of Baku together with his family. Asif has graduated from college and has owned a store where he sells food for a year now. He learned this business from his father who also had own store. At first Asif helped his father in his business and then decided to open his own store. He sells food and now needs 2000 AZN to buy cleaning products for resale because there's a demand for these products from his customers.

loans.use: To buy cleaning products for resale

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-at T. (in the photo) and her husband Mr. Thong Svay, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have two children:  one son and one daughter. One is in school and the other one is still young.

Sam-at has been a garment factory worker for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan of $800 to expand the house where she lives, to make it better for her family to live in.

loans.use: To expand the house where she lives.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mrs. Tha O. (in the photo with her loom) is a weaver. Her husband, Mr. Ros Sophal, is a rice farmer and does construction work when he is not at the farm. They live in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Tha and her husband asked for a Kiva loan several times already. Now she is requesting another loan of $400 to continue her weaving business by purchasing weaving materials.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen M. is 44 years old, married, and has one adult child. He lives in Trapeang Leuk village in Takeo province.  He is a cow middleman and a fisherman who is able to earn some money to support the family. His wife,  Nget Mich, is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support the family. She is a also Khmer cheese maker. To improve rice production, Sen M. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline to do farming during the dry season.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 32 years old and married. He graduated from high school.  He has an aluminum shop. He will use this loan to develop his shop and purchase aluminum bars and metal sheets. The borrower will use these materials to make doors, windows and tables. He has a good character in the market; he is a skilled man and has huge experience in his line of work. He has lots of customers due to offering good quality and inexpensive prices. The borrower has a great ambition to develop his business to earn a good income.

loans.use: Purchasing aluminum bars and metal sheets

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly O. is married and has one child who attends school.  He is both a motor taxi driver and rice farmer. His wife is a weaver. They live in a village off National Road number 2, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Ly is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Azar

texts.ru:
Azar T. 26 let. On rodilsya i jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Azar ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Azar oknchil shkolu i posle cheqo po nachalu pomoqal svoyemu dyade po rabote v magazine a potom reshil sam nachat rabotat i stal taxistom. 
On uje 5 let kak rabotayet taxistom. Seychas Azar nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit  nujniye zapchasti ldya yeqo mashini.
texts.en: Azar T. is 26 years old. He was born and lives in the city of Baku together with his parents. Azar is not married and does not have children. Azar graduated from high school and at first was helping his uncle with work in the store and later decided to start working as a taxi driver. He has been driving taxi for five years now. At this time Azar needs 2000 AZN to buy the necessary spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the car

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
