Jonathan E. is from the village of Bayombong in Nueva Vizcaya. He is 35 years old. Jonathan is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jonathan owns & operates a jeepney transport service. Jonathan has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Jonathan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonathan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to repair his vehicle for better service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jonathan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair vehicle

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok M. and her husband, Ry Rum, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. In the rice field, it is time for growing. To improve rice production, Mrs. Sok M. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer and to hire farming laborers to grow rice. She lives in Trapeang Leuk village, Takeo province. She supports three children, one of whom is a fisherman and two of whom attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilize and to hire farming laborers to grow rice

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda M. is 35 years old and his wife, Sokheng Bo, is 34 years old.  They live in a village off National Road Number Two, about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh.  Chenda has been driving a motor remoque for 14 years. (A remoque is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back.). The trailer is old and breaks often, so he spends a lot of money to repair it. Facing this, he is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a new remoque to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a new remoque to replace the old one

loans.name: Mrs. Chuk Srey Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nine people make up a village bank loan group located in Run village in Takeo province. They will use their portion of the loan for varied ways to support their families. Chuk S. T. is the president of the group.  She was selected by the other members. She owns a general store in local village where she earns money by selling groceries to support her family. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand.  Chuk S. T. is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to sell. Her husband, Vannak Sien, is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. The couple supports three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, one of whom is a laborer, and one of whom attends the local public school.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Yondonjamts

texts.en: Yondonjamts T. is 37 years old, married and has two daughters who attend school.  They live in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. In 2003 he began operating a cafe inside his ger. Uvurhangai is located on a main road which connects western provinces with Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He operates the ger cafe business on a busy road. Passengers who travel the long road stop at the ger cafe to have a meal and to take a rest. He has been transporting food materials from Ulaanbaatar with his own car. Yondonjamts's ger cafe is open 24 hours a day. He is a hardworking and active person who says, " I want to expand my business in order to be able to support my daughters and give them a very good education." He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase food to keep his ger cafe business running as customers traveling from place to place are increasing due to Tsagaan Sar, the Mongolian traditional New Year.

loans.use: To purchase food

loans.name: Peng

texts.en:
Mr. Peng P. and his wife (pictured together) live across the Mekong River and about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have six children, four sons and two daughters.

Peng is a fisherman, and he also sells cows. He hopes to continue expanding his business selling cows, so he has applied for a loan of 600 USD to purchase additional cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is 63 years old, married, and has two children. He graduated from primary school. He has a mini-market and he will use this loan to purchase supplies and foodstuffs. The borrower has a good reputation in the market due to his age and secondly due to the good quality of the products that he sells. The borrower has a good experience in selling these items to customers; as a result customers do their shopping at his market.

loans.use: For purchasing supplies and fresh fruit

loans.name: Choem Samnang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Choem S. is the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending a local public school. She lives in Samchat village in Takeo province. Choem is a farmer wH. owns a small piece of land upon which she grows rice and is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. La Siek, sells bread.

Choem was selected to be the leader of a group of five women wH. are taking out a group loan. Each member will use her portion of the loan for her own purpose to support her family. Choem has a problem in that her pigs are too undernourished to sell. To improve their condition, Choem will be using her portion of the loan to buy more pig feed.

loans.use: To buy more pig feed

loans.name: Ikhtiyar

texts.ru:
Ikhtiyar jenat i imeyet 2 detey, Odna iz kotorix uje xodit v shkolu. Ikhtiyar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Furuli regiona i seychas jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so sovoyey jenoy i lubimimi detmi. Ikhtiyar A. 32 qoda. 
On uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya pereprodajey produktvov i imeyet magazin. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Ikhtiyara, v perviy raz on bral 1200$ i za etu summu on ochen blagodaren Kive i lenderam. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit svoy magazin. 

http://www.kiva.org/lend/67975
texts.en:
Ikhtiyar is married and has two children. One of his daughters is going to school. Ikhtiyar is an internally displaced person and has relocated from Furuli region and now lives in the city of Baku together with his wife and beloved children.

Ikhtiyar A. is 32 years old. He has been reselling food for five years now and has own store. This is Ikhtiyar's second loan, his first loan was for $1,200USD and he is very thankful to Kiva and lenders for this sum. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to expand his store.

loans.use: To expand his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing boxes of milk, butter, margarine, sugar, canned food etc

loans.name: Byambatsogt

texts.en:
Byambatsogt I., 45, is married and lives with his wife and three children in Harhorin, the ancient capital of the Mongolian empire. Two of his sons attend a local school. He is a certified carpenter and started his woodcraft business in 2005. He is a hardworking and modest person.

Byambatsogt and his wife work for a construction company in the summer and operate his business in the winter. He mostly makes wood furniture such as closets, cupboards, mirrors and windows. He also receives orders for parts for ger construction, a ger being a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. He makes his wood products in his own backyard.

Byambatsogt is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to get more wood and materials for his business.

loans.use: To get more wood and materials

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica D. P. is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Bantayan on the island of Cebu, a part of the Visayas islands. She has two businesses: selling crab and other sea foods and operating a sari-sari (variety) store. Her husband, Teresito D. P., 49 years old, works as a fisherman and helps with his wife's business activities. They have two children who are nineteen and eight years old.

Veronica joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Veronica has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 20,000 PHP, so lifting the family's standard of living.

Veronica is now borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use to fund her businesses. She wants to continue to save up for the future and give her children a good education and improve their lives. Veronica is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mehradj

texts.ru:
Mehradj A. 29 let. On jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Mehradj ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On uje 7 let kak raboteyet taxistom, rasnhe on rabotal voditelem avtobusa  1 qod no potom reshil stat taxistom. Etot bizness yemu nauchil yeqo druq kotoriy toje taxist. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya mashini chto bi pochinit yeqo.
texts.en: Mehradj A. is 29 years old. He lives in the city of Baku together with his parents. Mehradj is not married and does not have children. He has been working as a taxi driver for seven years and used to work as a bus driver for one year before he became a taxi driver. His friend has taught him about this business, who also drives taxi. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts to repair his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the car

loans.name: Um's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. U. O. is a widow with six children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factories, one is a constructiO. worker and the others are attending a local public school. They live in Angk Ta Nu village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family.

U. was selected by the three other members of her group to be the head of a group loan. Each member will use her portiO. of the loan in different ways to support her family.

U.’s problem is that her kitchen is too old to use, so she will be using her portiO. of the loan to add to her savings to rebuild her kitchen.

loans.use: To rebuild her kitchen

loans.name: Rose Mwangulu

texts.en:
Rose Mwangulu L. is 39 years old and married to Mwarandu. Together they have four children.

Rose has been in the tailoring business for the last seven years. This is her first loan from KADET. With it she plans to purchase cloth, sewing notions and material for linings.

Rose’s profits will be used to purchase more sewing machines and employ more staff. Her dream is to succeed through KADET.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, sewing notions and material for linings

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida G. is 56 years old, married and lives in Bantayan municipality on Cebu island, one of the Visayas islands. She sells fruit. Brigida has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard selling fruit, she has gradually made her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 15,000 PHP.

Brigida is borrowing 26,000 PHP, her 21st loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, so that she can purchase more fruit to sell. Her previous loan of 26,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Brigida aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man. He is from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three young children. He has been working as a freelance construction agent since 2000. He cooperates with his wife who works as a teacher to help earn the family income. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his business by purchasing additionA. tools and other items. He is working hard to be able to stick with multiple construction projects.

loans.use: to improve his business

loans.name: Rasim

texts.ru:
Rasim A. 49 let. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey odin iz kotorix jenat i 2 iz kotorix  ne jenati. Rasim jivet v qorode Baku smeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i detmi. Rasim uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya prodajey fruktov i ovoshey, ranshe on imel produktoviy magazin no potom on reshil pomenyat. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit vrukti i ovoshi dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Rasim A. is 49 years old. He is married and has three children one of whom is married and two are not. Rasim lives in the city of Baku together with his beloved wife and children. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for ten years and before that he had owned a grocery store. Right now he needs 2000 AZN to buy fruits and vegetables for resale and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new machine to help her make boots

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is 22 years old and single. He graduated from Industry Preparatory School. He owns a mini-market and sells various foodstuffs. The borrower will use this loan to develop his shop and purchase goods such as sugar, tea, and rice. The borrower has a good character in the market. Lots of customers do their shopping at his market. The borrower has a great ambition to enlarge his shop and earn more income.

loans.use: For purchasing materials & a vertical fridge

loans.name: Estelle Rajy

texts.fr:
Jeune femme de 32ans d’âge, restauratrice dans son quartier à coté d’un atelier de menuiserie. 
Après son échec au baccalauréat et son accouchement , elle a préférer faire des petit plats qu’ elle vend pour subvenir aux besoins quotidiens, à ce jour elle prépare plusieurs plats et a un restaurant où chacun vient manger avec appétit.

Avant le premier  prêt , ses revenus étaient de  30.000F par jour, en augmentant son activité, car elle a ajouté la boisson et autres denrées qui attirent ses clients. Ses revenus sont maintenant  à plus de 80.000F. Le prochain prêt viendra pour améliorer ses conditions de vente et ouvrir un restaurant plus moderne.

Elle vend pour aider ses parents qui sont à la retraite à s’occuper de ses petit frères et sœurs qui vont à l’école.
texts.en:
A 32-year old woman who runs a diner in her district next to a joiner’s workshop.
After failing her qualifying exam for entering college and giving birth to her child, she has decided to cook meals for sale in order to support herself. She  continues to cook various dishes and has an eatery where all enjoy coming to eat.  

Before her first loan, her sales were 30,000 West African Francs per day. She expanded her business by offering drinks and other staples to attract customers. Her sales are now over 80,000. The next loan will serve to improve her vending conditions and help modernize her diner. She runs this business to help her retired parents and to provide for her younger brothers and sisters, who are in school.

loans.use: Purchasing boxes of fresh groceries, oil jugs,  seasoning, dishes,  kitchen utensils

loans.name: Ibragim

texts.ru:
Ibragim S. 29 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz Kalbadjar regona i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jeniy i detmi. 
Ibragim uje 6 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom perenosa stroitelnix materialov na svoyey qruzovoy mashine. On rabotayet vse dni nedeli bez vixodnix. Seychas Ibragim nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya qruzovoy mahsini.
texts.en:
Ibragim S. is 29 years old. He is married and has two children. He is an internally displaced person and has been relocated from Kalbadjar region and now lives in the Absheron region together with his beloved wife and children.

Ibragim has been in the business of transporting building materials on his truck for six years. He works every day and on weekends. At this time Ibragim needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts for his truck.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Carine

texts.fr:
Carine a 30 ans est  très active en coiffure et esthétique depuis 2004 après sa cessation comme agent à l’aéroport ou elle préparait des plats pour des vols nationaux.

IPCA coiffure est sa référence et set installée sur une avenue très fréquentée par des jeune filles qui se coiffe avec des tissages à la mode.
Son créneaux, faire un travail professionnel, le respect envers ses clientes, l’accueil  et l’utilisation des produits de haut de gammes.

Du lundi au samedi, elle a des recettes qui avoisine  les 15000f  pendant les périodes de cérémonies comme mariages, baptême, fêtes de fin d’année et autres fêtes religieuses les revenus arrivent jusqu’à 75.000f jour. 

Mère célibataire et 2 enfants à sa charge, IPCA, se bats pour leur réussite scolaire et veut ouvrir une salle de soin esthétiques avec son second prêt pour être une professionnelle de renommée nationale.
texts.en:
arine is 30 years old. She has been  very active working as a hairdresser and beautician since 2004, after leaving her job at the airport where she used to cook meals for national flights.

Her business is know as “IPCA hairstyling,” located  on a busy avenue and very popular with young women who let their hair to be styled in fashionable braids. Her guiding principles are professionalism in her work, respect and friendly welcome offered to her clients and the use of high-quality products. From Monday to Saturdays, her sales approximate 15000 West African Franc. During festivities, such as weddings, christenings, end of the year holidays and other religious holidays, her sales go up to 75,000 per day. 

A single mother with two children in her care, she works hard to provide them with a good education. With her second loan, she would like to open a beauty salon and become a nationally known beautician.

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics such as hair gel, hair straightener, facial cleansers, manicure and pedicure products

loans.name: Mrs. Kun Roeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The eleven people who make up this village bank loan group have selected Mrs. K. R., to become their village bank president. They are located in Pris Leu village in Takeo province. They will each use their portion of the loan in varied ways to improve their standard of living. 

Mrs. K. R. is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family and she is also a pig breeder. Since her second business is getting on well, she wants to expand it. So Mrs. K. R. is applying for a loan to buy more five piglets and pig feed. Her husband, Mr. Riem Kum, is a palm juice collector who can earn some money from selling  palm sugar to support his family. Through these activities, they support two children, one of whom is employed in garment factory. The other is a student in local public school.

loans.use: To buy more five piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Dédé Amivi

texts.fr: Dame Amivi est mariée et a 32 ans. Elle a un enfant  en sa  charge. Elle est coiffeuse de profession Pour pouvoir contribuer au menage, mais elle a associé  la vente de mèches et les achète  au grand marché de Lomé. Elle compte 3 ans dans cette activité et revend les mèches dans un salon de coiffure  sur la route Lapampa.  Elle demande un prêt pour acheter 5 douzaines de Tissage Noble et 5 douzaines de mèche Nina. La dame est habillée  en tissus pagne
texts.en: Dédé Amivi  is 32 years old, married, and has a child entrusted to her care. She is a hairdresser by profession To contribute to  household expenses, she also sells hair extensions that she buys at the Lomé Grand Market.  She has operated this business for 3 years and sells the hair pieces in a hair salon on the La Pampa Road . She is requesting a loan to buy 5 dozen Tissage Noble and 5 dozen Nina hair extensions. She is dressed in pagne fabric.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions

loans.name: Mrs. Tuon Mouv Village Bank Group

texts.en: Located in Pris Leu village, Takeo province, this village bank group consists of eleven people led by Mrs. Tuon M., the village bank president. They will each use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their families. Mrs. Tuon M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family and she is also a rice seller. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Tuon M. is applying for a loan to buy more rice to resell. She is a widow with four children, two of whom are employed in garment factories, and another one is a laborer, and the other is a student.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell

loans.name: Kossivi Agbéményan

texts.fr: Monsieur S. est marié et a un enfant  en charge. Il est âgé de 31 ans. Pour faire face aux besoins de sa  famille, il fait la vente de friperie. Il est né à Lomé et habite à Attiégou. Il a débuté en 2007 cette activité et s’approvisionne en gros  au  marché local de hedzranawoé. Il revend les habits en détail. Il sollicite un prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperie.
texts.en: Mr S. is married and has one child in care. He is 31 years old. To provide for his family, he sells second-hand clothes. He was born in Lomé and lives now in Attiégou. He began this activity in 2007 and buys his inventory wholesale at the market in Hedzranawoé. Then he retails the clothes. He applies for a loan to buy two bales of used clothing.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Mrs. Vorng Sarann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. V. S. is the village bank president who has been selected by fifteen people who make up a village bank loan  located in Trapeang Young village in Takeo province. They will each use their portion of the loan in a way that will improve their family's living conditions.

 Mrs. V. S. is a weaver who is able to earn some income to support her family. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. V. S. is applying for a loan to buy more silk for weaving. Her husband, Mr. Chanra Lor, is a construction worker and a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. This couple supports three children, two of whom are students, while the youngest one is 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving

loans.name: Mrs. Siek Thy Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of eighteen people who live in Trapeang Young village in Takeo province. Mrs. Siek T. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members who will each use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their families. She is a weaver who can earn some money from selling silk cloth to support her family. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Siek T. is applying for a loan to buy more silk for weaving. Her husband, Mr. Tet In, is a laborer and a driver. This couple is bringing up four children, one of whom is a laborer, while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 28 years old and married. He graduated from primary school. He has a garage and he is balances tires on various automobiles. 

The borrower will use this loan to develop his garage which is located in an industrial area. He will purchase equipment that he will use in his business. The borrower offers excellent services to his clients. He has a good reputation  in the industrial area despite his young age. He charges reasonable fees for his service.

loans.use: For purchasing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married woman living with her husband and two school-aged children. She has worked as a photographer for more than 10 years. In 2004, she decided to open a small photography shop and began her own camera work. She helps her husband who works in the car mechanics field with the family income. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new camera so that she can do her work competently by taking professional pictures and as a result increase the number of her clients and therefore her income.

loans.use: to purchase a new camera

loans.name: Mrs. Pann Sameur Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 14 people located in Trapeang Young village in Takeo province. Each member will use their portion of the loan in various ways to support their family.
Mrs. Pann S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is a widow who lives with five members in her household. Mrs. Pann S. is a farmer who owns a 1.2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. She also works as a weaver. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Pann S. is applying for a loan to buy more silk for weaving.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Madame Ayawa  est mariée  et a 28 ans. Elle a 2 enfants en charge. Pour pouvoir participer au  ménage, elle fait la boulangerie. Elle s’approvisionne au niveau du grand Moulin de Lomé la capitale du Togo et revient   préparer les pains à Tokoin  Wuti où elle revend en même  temps. Elle compte 8 ans  dans cette activité. Pour se réapprovisionner et satisfaire plus de clients, elle demande un prêt au près  de WAGES.
texts.en: Mrs Ayawa, aged 28, is married and supports two children. To contribute to household expenses, she does baking. She gets her supplies at the great mill of Lomé, the capital of Togo, and then travels back to Tokoin Wuti where she bakes and sells her bread. She has 8 years of experience in this activity. In order to replenish her inventory and serve more customers, she came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents. He has owned a photocopy and printing shop since 2002. He became involved in this field at a very young age to help his family with the income. 

Today he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an electric generator for his shop in order to meet his customer’s demands to visit him anytime so that he can increase his sales and then his profits.

loans.use: To purchase an electric generator

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old divorced woman from Lebanon. She lives on her own. In 2005, she started to work as a clothing seller from her house and from time to time, she passes by her client’s houses to offer them her products. In parallel, she has worked in a vegetable shop for one year. It’s very common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs to cover expenses. 

Today she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products to increase her sales, allowing her to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

loans.name: Chynybek

texts.en:
Chynybek A. is a 53-year-old villager, who supports his family by means of cattle breeding. He works in the local administration and is known as a very responsible person. Unfortunately, salaries in rural areas are low and people need to find an additional means of subsistence. For this reason, Chynybek’s family decided to engage in cattle breeding.
As Chynybek was born into a farmer’s family and had wide experience in animal breeding, his start in this activity was successful. He used his initial capital of only 2,000 KGS to buy cattle and managed to increase the number. Also, Chynybek began to cultivate barley and perennial herbs, which serve as concentration of forage for his cattle. With the revenues from his business, Chynybek gave a good education to his children which allowed them to successfully manage their lives.
Now Chynybek plans to use this loan of 25,000 KGS to buy one heifer. He wants to use the revenue from this loan to enlarge the number of his cattle. In future, he dreams of buying a car.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase a heifer

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children. She is from Lebanon. After having 10 years of experience in the clothing field, she started to sell lingerie from her house in 2004. She contributes to the family income with her husband, who works in a locA. company. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new products to enlarge her business operation and get higher profits.

loans.use: To purchase new products

loans.name: Zipora

texts.en: Zipora is a 36-year-old married woman with five children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in fish for the last 15 years. She initially started out with a passion fruit business but later changed to fish selling. Her biggest challenge is fishmongers who sometimes steal the money she gives them to buy fish. Her vision is to have business capital of 40,000,000 UGX and to educate her children. Zipora is requesting a loan to buy bags of fish for resale.

loans.use: To buy bags of fish for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 43-year-old widow with two children aged 26 and 24. She is a hardworking woman who sells water to earn her daily bread. She also earns extra income from her rental houses. She was previously employed as a casual worker in a coffee-processing company.
Jane is a member of New Kujitegemea group in Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. She has previous benefited from the group because she has taken two loans through the group. This is because the group members guarantee each other's loan. She is also able to save her money on a weekly basis through the group. She has requested another loan, of 80,000 KES, to purchase a water tank and pipes. Jane hopes to improve her business in the future and become a well-known water vendor.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and pipes

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is a 39-year-old married man with five children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Tom has been buying and selling produce for the last 13 years. He started his business in his village with capital of 500,000 UGX, but when the business expanded, he shifted it to town. His biggest business challenge is fluctuation in coffee prices. His vision is to expand his business, set up a business for his wife, build another residential house and educate his children. Tom is requesting a loan to purchase coffee for resale.

loans.use: To purchase coffee for resale

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en: Moureen is a 26-year-old married woman with three children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling palm oil and cotton for the last seven years. She started out with capital of 50,000 UGX and now has capital of 500,000 UGX. Her hardship is the difficulty in transporting the palm oil as it sometimes pours downwards. Moureen envisions educating her children and expanding her business. Moureen intends to use the loan to buy cotton.

loans.use: buying cotton for planting

loans.name: Passy

texts.en: Passy is a 39-year-old single mother of two children. She rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. Passy has been selling secondhand clothes for twelve years. She started out with capital of 100,000 UGX and she now has capital of 1,500,000 UGX. Her hardship is too much sunshine and her vision is to have a wholesale business and to build a house. Passy needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: buying secondhand clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single man living with one parent and two siblings. He is from Lebanon. He started his career at a very young age. In 2008, he started to work as a freelance electric specialist depending on customer’s requests. He helps his brothers with the family income. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $400 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an electric compressor to improve his business and reach a higher financial level.

loans.use: To purchase an electric compressor

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 41-year-old married woman with six children. She rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. Jane has been dealing in clothes for the last two years. She started out with capital of one million UGX and now has capital of four million UGX. Her hardship is the competitors and her vision is owning a boutique.

loans.use: buying  clothes for resale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy, 27, earns her living by running a pharmacy. She has been in the business for the past five years. Nancy was previously employed before she decided to open her own business. Through Faulu Kenya, she has managed to increase her business inventory. She hopes to open a clinic with the support of her husband, who is a doctor. She has requested a 50,000 KES loan to add to her stock of medicine and to buy a blood pressure machine.

loans.use: to add to her stock of medicine and to buy a BP machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a member of Riruta Genesis B, registered under Faulu Kenya.  She makes and sells soaps and detergents and employs one person in her business. She also sells secondhand clothes to supplement her family’s income. Mercy hopes to own a permanent business premise in the future.  She says that through Faulu Kenya, she has managed to educate her children. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy chemicals for manufacturing soap and detergents.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for manufacturing soap and detergents

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis forma parte del banco comunal “Cascada de Oro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Osorno. Él empezó vendiendo cajones de fruta y ahora tiene un minimarket en su casa, desde hace 5 años, en donde atiende junto a su esposa, quien también forma parte de Fondo Esperanza. Tiene una hija de 21 años, quien este año comienza a estudiar enfermería en la universidad. Entre los tres se turnan para atender el negocio todos los días de la semana desde las 7 hrs. de la mañana hasta las 11 hrs. de la noche.
Con este préstamo ampliará un metro y medio su negocio hacia delante, y comprará una vitrina y pasteles, ya que incluirá pastelería a su negocio. 
Vive con su esposa, sus dos hijos: la mayor de 21 y el menor de 15 y su única nieta de 4 años.
Su sueño es pagar los estudios de sus hijos, para que ellos tengan mejores oportunidades laborales. 
Para Luis y su esposa, Fondo Esperanza ha sido un importante aporte para su negocio, ya que gracias a los préstamos que han obtenido, han ido creciendo de a poco, incluyendo las máquinas necesarias y una mayor variedad de mercadería. También le han servido mucho  los talleres de educación emprendedora y de desarrollo personal que se les entregan durante las reuniones de banco comunal de parte de su asesor de Fondo Esperanza.
Osorno es una ciudad que se ubica en la zona sur de Chile, región de Los Lagos. Es un importante centro agropecuario que se identifica como "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" de Chile. Dentro de su actividad agropecuaria se destaca el cultivo de trigo y avena, la crianza de ganado, para el procesamiento de carnes y lácteos además de la fabricación de equipos agrarios.
Destaca en Osorno el único estadio de fútbol techado de Chile, el Estadio Municipal "Rubén Marcos”.
texts.en:
Luis is a member of the “Cascada de Oro” ("Shower of Gold") community bank in the city of Osorno in Chile.  He began selling boxes of fruit.  For the last five years, he has had a minimarket in his home, where he and his wife, who is also a part of the Esperanza microfinance partner, both work.  He has a  daughter, who started studying nursing at the university this year.  The three of them take turns attending the business every day of the week from 7 am to 11 pm.

Luis will use this loan to expand his business by one and a half meters in front and to buy a shop window and pastries, since his business includes a bakery. 

He lives with his wife, his two children, who are 21 and 15, and his only grandchild, who is 4 years old.

His dream is to pay for his children's education, so that they can have better employment opportunities.

Esperanza has played an important role in Luis and his wife's business, as the loans they have obtained have helped them to grow slowly, allowing them to buy the necessary machinery and making it possible for them able to offer a greater selection of products.  They have also taken advantage of the business education and personal development workshops, which Esperanza holds during the meetings of the communal bank.
 
Osorno is a city in southern Chile, in the Lagos region.  It is an important livestock area, known in Chile as "The Country of Milk and the Land of Meat."  Farmers also grow wheat and oats as feed, for meat and milk processing, as well as for the use by agrarian groups.

Osorno has the only enclosed football stadium in Chile, the  "Rubén Marcos” municipal stadium.

loans.use: Expansion, buying a shop window and pastries

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del banco comunal “Alondra” perteneciente a la comuna de Tomé. Ella se dedica a realizar composturas y confecciones a pedido, de ropa y otros artículos como por ejemplo cobertores de cama, desde hace más de 6 años. 
Con este préstamo pagará el arreglo de su máquina de coser overlock y  comprará los materiales que le faltan: hilos y géneros.
Vive con su marido, quien trabaja de manera dependiente y su nieto de 14 años.
El sueño de María es seguir creciendo en su negocio, ya que cuando comenzó solo tenía una máquina de coser y ahora cuenta con cinco distintas, lo que le permite hacer más y mejores trabajos.
A María le han servido tanto los préstamos que ha recibido de Fondo Esperanza, como los talleres sobre cómo administrar su negocio, ya que aprendió a llevar registros de sus ganancias y gastos, lo que le ha permitido organizar su dinero de mejor manera.
Tomé es una comuna del sur de Chile, ubicada cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Biobío. Su economía local se sustentaba de manera importante en la actividad textil que se origina a fines del siglo XIX, con fábricas que producen paños de lana de oveja, Textiles Bellavista Oveja Tomé, cerrada en 2007, trayendo consigo altas tasas de desempleo que han sido cubiertas por nuevas actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Maria is part of the village bank "Alondra" in the community of Tomé.  For more than 6 years, she has been designing and producing clothing and other products like bedspreads as requested by her customers. With this loan she will pay to fix her sewing machine overlock and to buy materials that she is lacking - threads and fabrics.

She lives with her husband, who has a stable job, and her grandson who is 14 years old.  Maria's dream is to continue growing her business, since she began with only one sewing machine and now she has five, which allows her to make more and better products. 

Tomé is a community in the south of Chile, located near the city of Concepción in the region of Biobío.   The local economy is based largely on the textile activity that began in the 19th century, with factories that produce cloth of sheep's wool.  When  Bellavista Oveja Tomé Textiles closed in 2007, it caused a high rate of unemployment, which has gone down with the creation of new economic activities.

loans.use: Repair a sewing machine and buy materials

loans.name: Kareen

texts.es:
Kareen forma parte del banco comunal “Alondra” perteneciente a la comuna de Tomé.  Ella durante la semana vende huevos y también realiza composturas (arreglos de ropa). Los sábados vende ropa usada en una feria cercana a su casa. Además  en esta época de verano cocina humitas y pastel de choclo para vender. También durante las épocas navideñas vende productos con diseños navideños como por ejemplo manteles. Estos negocios los realiza desde hace 6 años.
Su hermana, quien también forma parte de Fondo Esperanza, le ayuda a vender la ropa usada en la feria y su mamá le ayuda a cocinar las humitas y los pasteles de choclo.
Con este préstamo comprará un horno de barro, para cocinar pan amasado, empanadas y otros productos, y también comprará los ingredientes que le faltan para seguir cocinado.
Kareen vive con sus padres, quienes trabajan de manera dependiente, con sus 2 hermanos y su pequeña hija de 2 años y medio.
Su sueño es tener una verdulería en su misma casa y comenzar sus estudios de enfermería, en marzo de este año.
Kareen está muy agradecida no solo de los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, sino también de los talleres sobre cómo administrar su negocio.
Tomé es una comuna del sur de Chile, ubicada cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Biobío. Su economía local se sustentaba de manera importante en la actividad textil que se origina a fines del siglo XIX, con fábricas que producen paños de lana de oveja, Textiles Bellavista Oveja Tomé, cerrada en 2007, trayendo consigo altas tasas de desempleo que han sido cubiertas por nuevas actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Kareen is part of the village bank "Alondra" in the community of Tomé.  During the week she sells eggs and also makes repairs to clothing.  On Saturdays she sells used clothing in a market close to her house.  In the summer season she also cooks humitas and corn cakes to sell.  During Christmas season, she sells products with Christmas designs, such as tablecloths.  She has been doing all of these activities for the past 6 years.

Her sister, who is also part of the Fondo Esperanza, helps her to sell the used clothing in the market, and her mom helps her to cook the humitas and corn cakes.  

With this loan she will be a mud-brick oven to make pan amasado (kneaded bread), empanadas and other products; she will also buy the ingredients that she needs to continue cooking.

Kareen lives with her parents, who have stable jobs, and with her 2 brothers and her young daughter, 2 1/2 years old.  Her dream is to have a fruit and vegetable store in her own home, and to begin studying nursing in March of this year.  

Kareen is very thankful not only for the loans from Fondo Ezperanza, but also for the workshops on how to manage her business.  

Tomé is a community in the south of Chile, located close to the city of Concepcion in the region of Biobio.  The local economy is based largely on the textile activity that begin at the end of the 19th century, with factories that produce cloth made of sheep's wool.  Textiles Bellavista Oveja Tomé closed in 2007, causing the rates of unemployment to go up, which have now been replaced by new economic activity.

loans.use: A mud-brick oven and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Karypbek

texts.en:
Karypbek K. is 46 years old, married and has four children. He is engaged in a transportation service but, in order to find additional means of subsistence for his family, Karypbek also breeds livestock. His wife works at the local hospital as a cleaner and also helps her husband with the farming. Karypbek started this business with initial capital of 2,000 KGS and now manages to earn about 4,000 KGS monthly.

Karypbek plans to use this loan of 85,000 KGS to buy three bull-calves and nine sheep. With the revenues, Karypbek wants to broaden his farm, which will allow him to pay for a good education for his children. Karypbek is a very hardworking person, who believes that his efforts will lead his family to a prosperous future.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon is a member of the Big Hope group in Faulu Kenya. He has been running a green grocery for four years. He also works as a casual laborer in order to meet his family’s needs. Since Gideon joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children because his business has improved. He hopes to expand his business and get capital for starting a transport business. Gideon also hopes to open other outlets for his business in the future. He has requested a 40,000 KES loan to buy bananas, mangoes and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy bananas, mangoes and tomatoes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 30-year-old member of Faulu Kenya. He is a businessman who sells CDs and DVDs in the Kibera slums. He started the business four years ago and employs one person. Joseph previously worked as an office messenger before he went into business. He hopes to open a one-stop music shop in the future. Joseph has requested a 30,000 KES loan to buy CDs, speakers and DVDs.

loans.use: to buy CDs, speakers and DVDs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.ar:
ان مقترضة كيفا البالغة من العمر 45 عاما" متزوجة وتعيش مع زوجها وولديها.
تملك محل لانجري منذ العام 1997 وذلك لاعالة زوجها واولادها. سمعتها جيدة وترغب اليوم باقتراض مبلغ وقدره 1000$ من كيفا لكي تقوم بزيادة مخزون المحل وبالتالي زيادة مدخولها لتحسين مستوى عائلتها المعيشي.
texts.en: The borrower is 45, married, and lives with her husband and two children.  Since 1997 she has owned a lingerie shop to support her family.  She has a good reputation and wants to now borrow $1000 from Kiva in order to increase the store’s stock, increase her income, and thus improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Increasing store inventory

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 29 years old, married and blessed with three children. He runs a barber shop and a retail shop for a living. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping him to develop his business. Julius hopes to expand his shop for more income. He believes that with more income, he will provide better education for his children. Julius has requested a 15,000 KES loan to add to his stock of cooking fat, sugar, maize flour and sweets.

loans.use: to add to his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.ar:
يبلغ مقترض كيفا من العمر 27 عاما" وهو أعزب يعيش مع عائلته واخوته الثلاث في لبنان.
يساعد اهله في مصاريف العائلة و يملك منذ العام 2008 سوبرماركت حيث يعمل بكامل طاقته لتغطية كافة المصاريف.
يرغب هذا المقترض باقتراض من كيفا مبلغ وقدره 1200$ بحيث يريد شراء بضاعة لتقوية مصلحته فيكون بذلك قادرا"
على زيادة مدخوله الشهري وتحسين معيشته وبالتالي معيشة عائلته.
texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is 27, unmarried, and lives with his family and three brothers in Lebanon.  
He helps his relatives with the family expenses and since 2008 has owned a supermarket where he spends all his energy working to cover the expenses.  The borrower wishes to take a loan of $1200 from Kiva in order to buy more goods to be able to increase store earnings, which would increase his monthly income and raise the standard of living for him and his family.

loans.use: Purchasing goods to increase store earnings

loans.name: Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en su primer ciclo actualmente.
El grupo "Creciendo Juntas" es muy responsable, todas las integrantes tienen actividades diferentes para poder mantener a sus respectivas familias.
La Sra. Liliana A. se dedica a la venta de ropas y también elabora productos de limpieza, que luego sus hijos mayores venden a las personas y vecinos del barrio.
Todas las integrantes del comité han podido progresar sólo con la ayuda económica de la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, por eso agradecen inmensamente su colaboración.
texts.en: This communal bank is in their first loan cycle.  The group "Creciendo Juntas" [Growing Together] is very responsible.  All the members pursue different activities to support their families.  Señora Liliana A. sells clothing for a living.   She also makes cleaning products that her older children then sell in their neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase t-shirts, shorts, blouses, pants, skirts and towels to sell.  Also, raw materials such as beef, chicken, eggs, corn, cassava, etc. for empanadas.  Cleaning products such as detergent, shampoo and conditioner.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and two children. She works as a female hairdresser at her domicile and she also serves her clients in their houses. She cooperates with her husband who works as a dairy products distributor to provide better living conditions for the family. She obtained her first Kiva loan and she was a very good client.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools and products to offer her clients better beauty services.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and products

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three young children. He has owned a car repair shop for 20 years. He is the only income source of the family. He has obtained three Kiva loans and he has been a very good client with punctual payments.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional equipment and tools to provide better services to his customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment and tools

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married woman living with her husband and one child.  She is from Lebanon. She sells a large variety of goods from her home to customers from her society. She works hard to support her family in cooperation with her husband who works in a local company. She sells different Lebanese food and products.

Today she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new oven to increase her productivity. In the future, she would like to rent out a small area to sell her merchandise as well as sell popular home-made food products.

loans.use: To purchase a new oven

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en su tercer ciclo. Todas las integrantes son muy responsables y buscan el progreso de sus familias. La Sra. Carmen F. se dedica a la venta de comestibles, orgarganiza actividades como la creación de este grupo "Virgen de Fátima".
Económicamente cuenta con la ayuda de sus cinco hijos.
texts.en: This committee is on its third loan cycle. All of the members are very responsible and seek to make life better for their families. Mrs. Carmen F. sells groceries and organises activities such as setting up this group "Virgen de Fatima". She is able to save money thanks to the help of her five children.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients for empanadas such as meat, chicken, cassava, eggs and corn; also fruit such as bananas, pineapples, oranges, melons and apples, etc.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana, de 28 años, vive en casa de su madre al lado de ella y de su esposo Julio de 27 años y de sus 2 pequeños hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace un año esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado de manera ambulatoria, manifiesta que le gusta mucho su labor pues puede variar pues comercializa por temporadas y so le permite captar clientes durante toda época del año. Ella trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde y aunque comercializa de manera ambulatoria, tiene muchos deseos de instalar su tienda en un mercado fijo para trabajar más estable. Roxana compra su mercadería a bajos precios en un gran emporio comercial de la ciudad y además vende a crédito lo que le permite ganar mejores rentas, además sabe que con mucho esfuerzo logrará cumplir con todas sus metas. Es el primer crédito con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá alcanzar el progreso. Roxana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en ropa, pues quiere ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en: Roxana is 28 years old. She lives in her mother’s house with her mother, Roxana’s 27 year old husband,Julio and their two small children. Together they work hard to make progress every day. For a year, this enterprising woman has been a transient merchant selling clothing and footwear. She expressed that she likes this work very much since she can vary products and market products based on season and that allows her to have customers throughout the year. She works from Monday to Saturday from eight in the morning to four in the afternoon. Although she travels for work now, she wants to open up a store in a permanent market to have more stable work. Roxana purchases her merchandise at a low price at a commercial market in the city. In addition, she sells products with credit which allows her earn more income. She knows that with a lot of effort, she will be able to achieve all of her goals. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time. She does not want to leave a bad impression on the people who made this contribution possible. Roxana plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a larger quantity of clothing, so she can offer her clients the best products.

loans.use: To stock up on clothing to fulfill the demands of her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase products such as rice, oil, toilet paper.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: Emerita, de 30 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Emerson de 34 años, que es chofer, y de sus dos pequeños hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace seis años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la administración de un motocarro que conduce su esposo. Mientras él trabaja ella se encarga de administrar el dinero, no solo para el hogar si no también para la reparación de los dos motocarros que tienen en la actualidad, pues la segunda lo ofrece en alquiler. Esta muy satisfecha pues gracias a estos negocios ha logrado salir delante y ahora tiene muchos planes para el futuro, como el de instalar una tienda de comestibles, pues por la zona donde vive no hay un negocio así calcula que obtendrá buenas ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Emerita tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en cancelar la última letra de su motocarro, pues solo le falta una letra para que sea totalmente de su propiedad, así espera continuar adelante.
texts.en: Emerita is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, Emerson, of 34 years old.  He is a chauffeur and the father of her two small children.  Together, they work very hard every day to give their family a brighter future.  Six years ago, this entrepreneurial woman began managing the motorcycle that her husband drives.  While he is working, she is in charge of managing the money, not only for their household but also for the repairs of the two motorcycles that they currently own.  They rent the second motorcycle that they have.  She is very satisfied because this business has allowed her to move forward and make future plans, such as installing a grocery shop.  There isn't any business like it in the area that she lives.  This is her first credit with MFP and she promises to pay her dues on time since she doesn't want to appear irresponsible before the people that are making this possible.  Emerita plans to invest the credit in paying off the final payment due on her motorcycle.

loans.use: To pay off a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Jose Henry

texts.es:
José reside en Osicala departamento de Morazán, tiene 22 años de edad, está viviendo con su esposa y su hijo de dos meses de edad, José es dueño de un camión de carga y lo usa para comercializar arena y piedra, trabaja a tiempo completo abasteciendo a los clientes con materiales de construcción, tiene un año de experiencia en el trabajo.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para comprar materiales arena y piedra, los cuales necesita para continuar en el trabajo y ofrecer a los clientes, este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar el negocio y ha contar con este trabajo por un tiempo más.
Para José sus objetivos son muchos como el de poseer casa propia, estabilizar su situación económica, para alcanzarlos el tiene mucho esmero en su trabajo y no duda en llegar a realizarlos en el corto plazo.
texts.en: José lives in Osicala, a Department of Morazan.  He is 22 years old and lives with his wife and son of two months old.  He is the owner of a cargo truck, which he uses to sell sand and rock.  He works full time to supply his clients with construction materials and has over one year of experience in this sector.  He is seeking a loan in order to purchase more sand and rock, which would help him expand and maintain his business for a longer amount of time.  José has many objectives: possess his own home and stabilize his economic status.  In order to achieve this, he puts a lot of care into his work and is determined to reach his goals in a short amount of time.

loans.use: Purchase materials to sell, such as sand and rock.
